dialogues.speaker: GOING TO DO TONIGHT. THAT'S OKAY.
dialogues.text: Pulling back. Feminine HANDS now, in view.

dialogues.text: Stops. Finger taps the page thoughtfully. Reaches off -- re-enters with a DICTIONARY. Flips through it. . COG-NI-TIVE, adj. She scratches out the word COGNATIVE. COGNITIVE in its place. Sets aside the dictionary. Continues:

dialogues.speaker: COMFORT MY FATHER TO KNOW THAT MY SUICIDE
dialogues.text: Grabs the dictionary. Flips through... PERSEVERE, v. PERSERVERE wrong; PERSEVERE, that's got it...

dialogues.speaker: ONLY PARTIALLY TO HIM.
dialogues.text: A pause, then, as an afterthought:

dialogues.speaker: YOU THINK I'M STUPID, DADDY BUT I'M NOT
dialogues.text: BLACK SCREEN. Pause... then we SUPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA roams the canyons west. Starts high in the night air. DIPS toward the road, free-falling... Whooooosh..! Falls into line, alongside fast-moving CARS, all rushing uphill... To an opulent HOUSE. . LIMOS rolling in, as we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It's hard to believe it was just last Christmas that me and Harmony changed the world. We didn't mean to; and it didn't last long -- ‘a thing like that can't. (beat) Thanks for coming. I guess you'd call this a detective story; there are dull parts, but there's a murder in it. Also a broken heart so I guess it's a love story. Oh, and everything's connected, it all loops back around, it’s cool. My name's Harry Lockhart, I’1l be your narrator. Welcome to L.A. Welcome. to the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera descends, huge GALA in progréss. Wall to wall money. Two JUNIOR AGENTS go by, deep in debate: ICM TYPE . Okay, you can own any film; you want STAR WARS? You can have it -- exact movie, everything's 100% the same -- except in the middle, Yoda points and says, "Luke, you dumbfuck! Quit dickin’ around and pay attention." Then it goes back to normal. Rest of the movie, exactly the game. Would you, invest..? AN ALMOST HANDSOME MAN enters, dressed a tad shabby, sports the only tie he owns; welcome HARRY, our narrator.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That's me: Harry. Now that I'm in L.A., I go to parties -- the kind where if.a girl is named Jill she spells it J-Y-L-L- E, that bullshit. ' Before he's ten feet in, a tricked-out BLONDE approaches:

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: Hi. What do you do for a living? No preamble; just like that. Harry smiles: HARRY. I invented dice.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you..? The blonde shrugs. Says off-handedly:

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: I do a little acting. FLASH: THE BLONDE, NAKED atop Andrew Stevens. She looks up, SHRIEKS--! A CREATURE swipes a CLAW at her. A bad replica of her HEAD blasts through a glass WINDOW. BACK TO SCENE: The blonde smiles. Pause, then:

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: I'm gonna see who else is here. She walks away. He watches her go. Shifts his gaze -- LOCATES TWO MEN in the crowd. One's portly. Sucks ona cigarette, then glares at it like it just made him angry. The other is trim, wide-shouldered. :

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Guy smoking, that's Dabney Shaw, my producer; he "discovered" me. The man walking with him is Perry van Shrike, AKA Gay Perry; honest-to-God private eye, consults in film, TV. . Just incorporated, he's big time. Also he's gay. Producer Shaw and Gay Perry wander. near another, OBVIOUS GAY MAN (Perry is not obvious, F.Y-I.) and overhear:

dialogues.speaker: OBVIOUSLY GAY MAN
dialogues.text: ... I said I wished I was Queen Blizabeth, and he goes, "Oh, baby, you sure you want to be a virgin Queen..?"

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) All these gay stories. Christ.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Scares you, that sort of talk...?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Don't start, Perry. Look, I seen you play ball, I know you're tough, it's just... you see a guy's wally, your brain goes to, "I wanna grab that," for me, see, that's... that's a real leap. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHAW (cont'd) It's like, "Hey, an elephant -- Quick, let's use its blood to paint my boathouse." Not the first thing you think of. BACK WITH HARRY: He discovers a VAST ROOM -- 300 people.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: L.A. -- By now, you may wonder how I wound up here... or maybe not, maybe you wonder how Silly Putty picks shit up from comic books, point is, I don't see another Goddamn narrator, so pipe down. How'd I get here? See for yourself. CUT TO BLACK. Pause... then, over black we SUPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOY STORE. The east Village, Manhattan. The interior is hushed, dark. Closed for business. : An idea which seems lost on HARRY LOCKHART. He pushes a TRAM, heaped with toys he's stealing. Nearby, his pal RICHIE BAUER; similarly engaged. : Harry's on a CEL PHONE. Speaking in hushed tones:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look, I'm going nuts here... Say. it again, I must be missing something...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Cyber-Agent: C-Y-B --.look,. why don't you ask, like, an employee or something? i HARRY . They're all busy. Hah! Here. ' Shines his light on a doll: PROTOCOP ~ Protector of Man.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Protocop, is that it..? Protector of Man, he protects men.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad. Look up. Is there a sign..? Harry shifts the beam upward, sees: BARGAIN BIN.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That show was cancelled two years ago. Just ask a -- wait, are they even open?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Holiday hours. Look, I gotta go, I'll find it --

dialogues.speaker: ON JUNCTION BOX
dialogues.text: We see the security system has been RE-ROUTED. Alligator clips, bridging the circuit. Nice work -- Until a BUS GOES BY outside. Wall, vibrating... One of the clips POPS free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BURGLAR ALARM, ringing. Continuous. HARRY and RICHIE come bolting out of the store. Feet pounding. SIRENS, now, as prowl cars respond to the call.

dialogues.speaker: BAUER
dialogues.text: Shit! Shit! The men pitch forward into a big HEDGE. Crash through. Into a courtyard, into someone's PARTY. BAUER pulls out A HANDGUN. Waves it like a wand. People evaporate.

dialogues.speaker: BAUER
dialogues.text: It's not loaded, we should load it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not shooting anyone. Go right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry kicks the door, SPLINTERS it. They race inside. Pull up short, sucking air. Harry shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We're good. We're not going down, hear me? Richie. Hey. You with me..? A VOICE rings out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It stops them cold. They turn as one --

dialogues.speaker: BAUER
dialogues.text: Oh, for Chrissakes. It's a middle-aged. SOCIETY. WOMAN. In an EVENING GOWN. Holding a GLOCK PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ma'am... look, we... we didn't do anything, we're not dangerous -- BAUER looks down: his own GUN, in plain sight --

dialogues.speaker: BAUER
dialogues.text: Right! Look, see? It's not even loaded. He snatches it up to SHOW her -=

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Richie, NO! Bang--! Her gunshot passes THROUGH HARRY'S. ARM. Kills his friend. BAUER collapses. Echo, dying away. Harry, in shock. Looks at his pierced arm. Looks at his buddy --. a cut-string puppet.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You bitch..! THROWS the gun. Just does it, without thinking. She 13 DUCKS... He finds the WINDOW. Takes a running start --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i .Comes out, an explosion of glass. Hits, rolls -- Comes up running as the NEXT SHOT blows splinters from a tree.

dialogues.speaker: A POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: Comes squawling around the corner. Fuck. Harry flings himself down an alley. The night, ALIVE with sirens. He runs, breath sawing in and out. Rips off his jacket. Doesn't break stride, wraps his bleeding arm. UP AHEAD: People, milling outside a doorway. Sipping coffee. AA meeting on break? He slows to a brisk walk. BEHIND HIM, a prowl car rounds the corner.  He's got 10 seconds. Nods to the group ahead. Hi, how are you, I'm so fucking nonchalant, makes a production of YAWNING, ho-hum, hope they catch that fugitive -- Ducks into the building, fast. Jacket, masking his wound. A POLICE SPOTLIGHT stabs into the foyer, shit..! Harry picks a door, any door. Goes through it, FAST -~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tidy office. THREE PEOPLE look up, surprised -- At Harry, sweating. Going into shock. His face twitches and there's blood where Bauer: SPRAYED him.

dialogues.speaker: AN ELDERLY WOMAN
dialogues.text: (frowns disapproval) Sir, that's the wrong door. Please go back out and wait with the others -- One portly man is studying Harry... abruptly interrupts:

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Grace, I'd say this guy's ready to go. Doesn't he look ready to go? We recognize DABNEY SHAW, the producer from before. He smiles encouragingly. Harry, bewildered -- What's going on, don't .they notice he can barely stand up..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICE CRUISER stops; a COP gets out, scans faces as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seated trio watches, expectantly -- Harry's got paper in his hand. Gunshot wound, hidden. .Blinks. Swallows. Incredibly, begins to do an ACTING SCENE with the woman.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
dialogues.text: Where is he, where's Rafael? Harry, shaking. Breathing hard. Reads:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Um... beat on me all night. You want me to give up my client, you can go spit. Harry is swaying. _Close to blacking out. Jaw clenched. We hear the COP, now. Outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
dialogues.text: @ Quit acting like the goodguy, jerkoff. You got your partner killed. Harry looks up, startled. Recovers, looks down -- It's there. In the Goddamn script. He swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY WOMAN
dialogues.text: He was in over his head, you knew it. You pulled that trigger. YOU killed him. Harry leaps, SLAMS his fist on the desk. The casting people jump -- He’s delirious. Reality and fiction BLUR.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I didn't kill him, he... he wanted in... At which point, Harry begins to cry. .Wracking sobs.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why... Why'd he... have to come in on it, told him to stay home... Stupid son of a bitch... Shoulda been me, I killed him..! (breaks down, hugging himself) -+-I'm sorry... I'm sorry... @ Silence. Casting people, staring. Harry sobbing. THE COP throws open the door, hand on his holster --

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Oh, wow, sorry. (to Harry, lamely) Good luck. He leaves. The casting people look at Harry. At each other. SHAW has a gleam in his eye. Whispers:

dialogues.speaker: SHAW \
dialogues.text: This tape goes in the L.A pouch. And get mé Gay Perry on the line, will you..? He draws deep on his cigar... CUT BACK TO PRESENT DAY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY, looking thoroughly out of place. Reaching for a fork, his tie in the tomato sauce, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Now they're screen-testing me, is that wild? Anyway, that's how I got here. e (beat) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY (V.O.) (cont'd) Now, Harmony -- different story, she was destined to be here. That's her, by the @ way, at the fireplace. Harmony Faith Lane; IQ: 166. Job: Actress. Go.figure. New character -- our focus shifts to A WOMAN at the fireplace. Alternately eating pizza, sipping coffee. A predatory ICM TYPE listens, impatient, as she RANTS with a surprising fierceness:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: ee. yes, racist. I'm serious. Look,: the other reindeer laugh at him. They scorn him -- then, out of the blue, they NEED him for something, he's good-as a fucking... foglight, or whatever, so tell me, how's that any different from, 'Don't talk to Reggie, he's black. Oh, wait, he can play basketball? Sign him up!’ (yawns ) Sorry. Worked a double shift, then catered. Go ahead, ask me why I'm here. God knows. Rudolph, we teach it to kids, little kids. Hah. Want some coffee? She gets up to fetch some, he never gets in a word. @ CUT TO BLACK -- Pause... then SUPER:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Most people would say Harmony got to the party because of the stuff with the robot. I"11 get. to that -- but for me? The robot, uh-uh ~- I'd go back a bit farther. Like I said, destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARMONY, AGE 7: We're on her face. In the b.g., a.sign: Harold the Great, it reads sideways. Now the tricky camera ROTATES 45 degrees: the SIGN, no longer sideways. She's lying FLAT, encased by a painted wooden BOX. Head out one end, shoes the other. Big SMILE...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Harold, use your awesome might -- Save me from this hopeless plight!
HAROLD THE GREAT, age 9, nods to an OLDER KID: This kid in turn revs a CHAINSAW, starts cutting through the box.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: She found her vocation early in life. Chainsaw, ROARING. HAROLD flicks his WAND, intones:

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD
dialogues.text: Alakazaaaam----! Harmony starts to SCREAM. SHRIEKING. Writhing in agony. Tears streaming. Harold stares dumbly. The kid with the saw, horrified -- Chaos. ADULTS converge on the scene. Harmony is twitching. In shock. Her DAD leaps to the stage. Grips the lid, HEAVES OPEN THE BOX. Eyes wide, staring -- Harmony is unmarked. Unscathed. She looks at her father. Looks at Harold, solemnly says:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I'm going to be an actress. She has time to smile before Daddy's BACKHAND erases it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmony reads to sick MOM, .who lies in bed, beautific...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Papa felt her slipping away... he blamed her school, her friends... truth is, the culprit was right down the hall; that’s right, Harmony’s role model, growing up. Her hero, her best friend -- 1 (move in on Mom) \ Huh..? No, not her. Him. Whoops--! The camera breezes PAST MOM... stops on the BOOK COVER. -A steely-eyed MAN eyeballs us... The Title: You'll Never Die In This Town Again - A Jonny Gossamer Th

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: "'Go'to hell, Jonny Gossamer,' she told me. She'd poured herself into a seamless dress. From the look of it she'd spilled some. ‘Lady,’ I said, 'Where I live, it's not much of a commute...'"  11.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Jonny offered salvation; he spoke from the pages of cheap paperbacks, and told of a promised land... called Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: ECU
dialogues.text: JONNY GOSSAMER’S image, unspooling before us, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARMONY displays the putty to her SISTER JENNA, age 6. Jenna grins -- BOUNCES it, watches it soar sky high...

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Separate beds. HARMONY and JENNA; both asleep.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: She wished he was real, prayed he would come to Indiana -- POV HARMONY: The sliver of LIGHT underneath the bedroom door. Suddenly eclipsed by a SHADOW.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: «.. To save little sister Jenna --.who Papa wouldn't leave alone.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, IN THE DARK, NOW
dialogues.text: Staring numbly. Her sister's bed is now empty. Outside the door, Papa's retreating footfalls. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa turns on an upstairs LAMP, light STABS DOWNWARD -- Illuminates the SILLY PUTTY... Jonny’s rugged face. Now hideously distorted, twisted. Looking up... Helpless to interfere.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After Mom died, the girls were bundled off to Foster Care -~ good news for Jenna. (beat) Not long after that, Harmony skipped. FLASH TO: A BUS, TOOLING DOWN I-79. Inside, Harmony -- now a TEENAGER -- sleeps fitfully, a Jonny Gossamer book in her lap. Her eyelid twitches.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: On the bus to L.A., she had a nightmare; in it, her running away made the Foster parents so mad that they gave her sister back to Papa. Harmony woke up sweating... then decided that this couldn't happen, not in a good world where heroes existed. (beat) She didn't stop the bus. BACK TO THE PRESENT: PARTY HOUSE - HALLWAY — NIGHT HARMONY, exhausted. She ambles along, sipping coffee. Stops to admire a set of walnut bookshelves -~

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And that's how she got to the same party as me. Now, back to our sto -- The ONSCREEN IMAGE abruptly FREEZES. Harry swears:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Shit, I skipped something. Dammit! The whole robot bit, I make a big deal, and then I, like, totally forget. Fuck. This is bad narrating. Like my Dad telling a joke, "Oh, wait! Back up, I forgot to tell you, the cowboy rode.a blue horse." Fuck. Anyway, I don't even know if you wanna see it now, but here's the fucking robot stuff, for your viewing pleasure. I'm gonna look for something else to fuck up. Can I say fuck more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARMONY, age 34, splayed across the bed. Reading. In the background, the blue flicker of late-nite TV. 1

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Now back to PROTOCOP, starring Jeff Neal. ANGLE ON TV -- PROTOCOP blows holes in drug dealers. Harmony looks up at the screen for a moment. She puts aside her book... reaches for the TV remote and that's when she hears the loud THUMP. Her head snaps upward, alert ~- CRASH! No mistake this time. Breaking glass. She snatches up a wooden BAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, no HINT of caution by. the intruder. CLUMPING footsteps. Ponderous. Harmony inches down the hall... Reaches a corner. Hazards a look ~- SENSE DEPARTS. Fish grow wings; the Cubs win it in four. PROTOCOP, PROTECTOR OF MAN -~ all six-five of him. Pneumatic joints. Robot HEAD, swiveling. Impossible. His back is. to her. She darts a look at her bedroom: TV SCREEN -- PROTOCOP. Someone’s throwing acid on him. Returns her gaze to the kitchen -- Can't be real; she says, as the crimefighter bumps her cookie jar to the floor, where it SHATTERS -- And that's when it gets REALLY weird. The robot bends, joints clicking... Starts to eat the cookies. He's brought cheap WINE to wash them down. Enough is enough:

dialogues.speaker: HEY, YOU
dialogues.text: The behemoth reacts, STARTLED-! Stands. WHACKS his head on a cabinet. Lurches drunkenly onto the BALCONY -- Slips on a coiled HOSE. Crashes through the flimsy railing. Silence... followed by a distant THUD.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Flashing lights. Crime scene tape. A REPORTER does a stand-up, breath pluming in the chill air: .

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (TO CAMERA)
dialogues.text: ».- sources close to Neal, who has not worked as an actor in two years, said he seemed despondent earlier tonight, during a re-run of PROTOCOP. The actor, who retains the costume he wore on the’ show, allegedly dressed up, stumbled down the canyon road, and wandered into this Hollywood Hills guest house -- (points behind him) -- where aspiring actresss Harmony Faith Lane was shocked to discover him.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I'd jog by, "hi, hello," that kind of : thing... I feel for the guy, it's like... it's like this city can't get. enough of messing with people; like putting a whoopie cushion on the seat of. the electric chair. Like that. PULL BACK -- from a 52-inch.SCREEN. WIDEN to reveal a paneled OFFICE... Producer DABNEY SHAW looks up briefly -

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Huh. Those are some tits. (to his assistant) ) Find out who she is, invite her to something.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And there it was. Destiny, bingo. BACK TO THE PRESENT: PARTY HOUSE - HALLWAY - NIGHT |= -—— HARMONY, exactly where we left her. ‘Admiring BOOKS. Having coffee. Starts to turn away. Turns back, blinks: HER POV: It's the Jonny Gossamer books. All of them. She can scarcely believe it. Reverently withdraws the titles, one by one from the shelf, scanning covers... Small Town Boy Makes Dead * Little Girl Lust * Die Job She shuffles off, still clutching a book... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLOP. Harmony hits the bed. Two days, no sleep. She drowses off... book slipping from slack fingers. Lies, skirt hiked, hip laid bare. Party noise, continuous. The door opens -- The ICM TYPE we saw earlier peers in. Debates, if only priefly -- Enters. Shuts the door behind him. Stands over her. Puts a-hand on her thigh, squeezes....

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You'd better be her doctor.  The guy spins around, caught ~~ HARRY stands framed in @ the doorway. Big as life. Eyes flat. Cold.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Walk away. Don't think. Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: ICM TYPE
dialogues.text: Why? What are you, her brother or something..?. This is none of your business. I'll fuck you up, man.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. You'll try, and that little experiment will end in tears, my friend. The guy stares at him. Makes no move to leave.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Again, for the cheap seats -- do not THINK. Walk... the fuck... away. Or let's you and me go outside, but it's past my bedtime, MAKE A CHOICE. Eyes flat. Dead. Other guy thoroughly unnerved, CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: @ Harry gets the shit beat out of him. The ICM guy has him on the ground. Harry curled up ina defensive ball... The guy WAILING ON HIM. Over and over. The guy spits on Harry. Walks back inside the house. Harry kneels, sucking air. A shadow falls. across him -- GAY PERRY reaches out, helps him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: . HARRY
dialogues.text: Thanks... One of these days, buddy..? I'm gonna actually learn how to fight. POV - HARRY: He sees HARMONY, stagger to a car. Gets in, as the ICM type hops behind the wheel, roars off...

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY --
dialogues.text: You okay, man? Want some peroxide..?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nah. Thanks, though.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: (extends a hand) i ; Perry van Shrike.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: | @ Harry Lockhart. Whoa, wait a minute, I | heard about you, um, the whatchamacallit, the consultant, you must be -- (stops himself) Um, I mean...

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Gay Perry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (feigns ignorance) Oh! Right, right, ha, ha. Dabney calls you that. You guys must be old buddies.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Five years now.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Five years, wow. You still gay?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: No, I'm'hip-deep in pussy, I just liked the name so much I couldn't change it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: e@ Harry winces as Perry applies peroxide to the cut lip.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Dabney wants you to take. detective lessons.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: He's into this "method" thing, says you are, too. Hold still...” (daubs beneath Harry's eye) Tomorrow I got a surveillance, you game?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Surveillance. Who's the guy, like, a erimelord or something?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Please. I'm guessing a sad, lonely little man who singlehandedly haunts his : own house up in the hills. Harry stares -- whistles softly:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Wow. That was incredibly gay. Just then the HOST happens by, double-takes at Harry:

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Good God --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You should see the other guy.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Harry, I'd like you to meet Harlan Dexter. Our generous host.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Ah, of course! You're Dabney's golden boy. From back east. I hope it isn't past your bedtime.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, sir. Mom used to say I had the neon disease. When the neon lights came on, I'd wake up.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I'm similarly afflicted. My daughter lived 10 years in Paris, says it's heaven for the vampire set -- SUDDENLY, everything FREEZES. The film comes to a screeching STOP. Folks suspended, mid-sentence, we HEAR--

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Okay, I apologize. That is a terrible scene; it's like, why was that in the movie, gee, you think it'll COME BACK LATER, MAYBE? I hate that, a TV's on, talking about the new power plant, hmmm, wonder where the climax will happen; or the shot of the cook in HUNT FOR RED OCTOBER. So anyhow, sorry. THE MOVIE RESUMES. Dexter sees a mammoth CAKE go by: Happy Birthday Ronnie, it pinkly proclaims.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Excuse me, apparently, I'm to help cut this monstrosity. Dexter leads it OUTSIDE, where a generic L.A. blonde shrieks, gives Daddy.a big old hug... Perry scowls:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Mom's gone; now it's just him and his little born-again bundle of joy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Precious.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Isn’t it, though? (chuckles) Three months ago she was prosecuting him, he called her a cunt. Welcome to L.A.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: More exposition, please. Christ, we're really shoveling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The valets are busy chasing some DEER out of the road -- as HARRY & GAY PERRY wait for their cars.

dialogues.speaker: . HARRY
dialogues.text: ... That girl tonight, man, I'm tellin’ you, she had this... quality, like... like the girl in high school, you know the one you never could have? The one still haunts you..?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: I had that. Bobby Mills. Harry makes a lemon face; Perry tips the valet, gets in his car. Harry, trying lamely for camraderie --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You should, um, track him down. I got five bucks says you could still get him.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: That's funny. I got a ten, says, “Pass the pepper." And a couple quarters, do harmony on "Moonlight in Vermont.”

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Talking money.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: A talking monkey?  19.

dialogues.speaker: GAY. PERRY
dialogues.text: e Yes, a talking monkey. Ugly sucker. Traveled here from the future, only says "“ficus.” Detective lessons, tomorrow. Don't forget. (starts to pull away, stops) Oh, and Harry, your girl..? I know her, she did some work for me. You might try the Domino Room. With that, he roars off down the sloping drive -- CUT TO: FINGERS ON A KEYBOARD. An upbeat riff ushers us into: INT. THE DOMINO ROOM - NIGHT. HARRY enters the bar. Orients himself. Eyes, roving... An ABUNDANTLY-BREASTED GIRL comes up to him:

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Hey, there. I'm Flicka.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: @ What do you do? Again the question. Harry blinks.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm a private detective. You?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Stewardess. (pause, then:) Nice to meet you. ‘Bye. Wanders off. Easy come, easy go. He scans the crowd -- THERE. Harmony. At the bar. No sign of the asshole from before. Instead, a semi-attractive female FRIEND. As he watches, the FRIEND heads for the bathroom. Harmony alone, bingo -- he ambles up, trying for slick:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ‘Evening. I'm Harry. He winces, makes a show of rubbing his. shoulder.  20.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: @ Mmmm. Sore. (cracks his neck) I.mean physically, not, you know, like a guy who's angry in the 1950's. (beat) I'm visiting from New York. Um, I think I saw you at a party, couple hours ago..? She doesn't. look up. Sips her drink, says:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why what?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Why me? Seriously, how about that girl sitting over there, look, she's very pretty.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: @ On the left. Next to bald Kevin Costner. Indicates a bald guy. Looks vaguely like Kevin Costner.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Jesus, that's reaching. Um, look, I'm interrupting, I feel badly, at least let me buy you a-~

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Bad.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Bad. Um, what's--?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: You feel bad. Badly is an adverb, so to “feel badly" would be saying that the mechanism which allows’ you to feel is broken.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, then. (clears his throat). That girl over there, you said..?
a - HARMONY e Which way you lookin'..? (shakes her head) Nix, nix, that's the blonde; blonde's pathetic. .

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Pathetic, I see. Because..?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Well, for starters, she's been fucked more times than she's had hot meals.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Right. I-heard about that, it was neck and neck, then she skipped lunch --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Worst thing, though..?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Do tell.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Worst thing is she's 35 years old, still trying to act. I see her in auditions; @ It's over, baby, you missed. Get a clue.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's charitable of you. (beat) Mind if I ask how old you are?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. How old are. you?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Thirty-four. (chews ice) I'm a baby. She grins. Upends her glass.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where's your buddy? The guy you left the party with?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Fucking asshole. I just needed a ride. (eats peanuts) Sorry. I swear a lot. Did you know the host? I didn't. He looked really familiar, though. Probably an actor. Before he can reply, the FRIEND returns.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FRIEND
dialogues.text: Buzz, buzz. Go away, Mister fly.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm talking to your friend here.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FRIEND
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, she doesn't wanna talk to you. Leave.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Easy, Sunshine, I'll have her back to you in. a minute. .

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FRIEND
dialogues.text: She. doesn't have a minute. He starts. to retort -- bites it back. What's the point?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: If you change your mind about that drink, I'll be over there with old Timothy Hutton. Harmony glances over -- blurts a LAUGH. Can't help it, he's spot-on. Harry gestures to the bartender to cover the girls' drinks. Debates which credit card to use -- HARMONY grabs his VISA card. Makes it dance on the bar:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Pick me, pick me! (deep. bass voice: ) No, pick me! She grabs his MASTERCARD. Makes the two cards fight. Harry looks at her like she's grown a tail. . She giggles

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FRIEND
dialogues.text: Stop it! Why are you humoring him? ‘ (to Harry:) There's a table in that far corner..? It's a recommended cheeseball hangout.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Your mouth is a recommended place to put a sock. (beat) Princess... Scary friend... Goodnight. He shrugs on his coat. Turns away. HARMONY, looking more and more agitated, until, finally --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Harry Lockhart, are you gonna recognize me or not? That stops him. He turns back, frowning. Squints --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Embrey, Indiana! (he's still frowning) Loved snakes, scared of spiders..? (exasperated) God's sakes, you -- you were the Amazing Harold, no, HAROLD THE GREAT, you cut me in half, remember?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: God... My God, Harmony..? Is that you? Realization, dawning. Both frozen in place —- Then she smiles and so does he and the years all drop and shatter. He ENGULFS her in a hug. SPINS her. The FRIEND gapes in disbelief. CUT TO BLACK --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Okay, Okay. I was_.a bad narrator, I skipped something. The little kid, the one who cut her in. half? The magician, right, that kid. Well, that was me. I apologize. Harry, Harold, you shoulda caught that. Some detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmony's FRIEND, dazed. Out of it. Head tilted back. HARMONY strips the label from a beer bottle, frowning...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Leaving my. sister... Leaving her alone ‘ back there..? Hardest thing I ever did. Harry can't stop staring, mesmerized. We HEAR, supered:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Connections. Remember how I said this high school chick haunted me? How seeing Harmony made me think of her..?

dialogues.speaker: PEP RALLY
dialogues.text: Young HARMONY, age 16, among them. Kicking. Cheering.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, that's ‘cause it fucking WAS her, I'm, like, the stupidest motherfucker on earth. {sighs} It all came flooding back, how I was the one she confided in; the one. she trusted. Meanwhile, she was doing every other guy in school.

dialogues.speaker: BASEBALL DUGOUT
dialogues.text: Her head leans against YOUNG HARRY's. chest. She's erying.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It was the first time I felt it, how pitying someone and wanting to fuck them can get all tangled up in your head. Overwhelming sadness, meanwhile you got a Rodney. Is that sick? I think that's sick. BACK TO PRESENT DAY: HARMONY, tipsy. Excitedly reminiscing. HARMONY . Hey-! Remember when we were real little, a movie crew came to town? 1

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Right..! Mystery flick, who the hell was the detective, Jonny something --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Gossamer.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Jonny Gossamer, right. Your Mom bought all the books. Went nuts. .

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: God, that was forever ago.
Pause... then, very quietly, she says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get famous, Harry. He watches her flatten the beer label in her palm. Leans forward, very intense, pronounces one word:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY AND HARMONY. Laughing, silly... They walk, hips brushing. The female FRIEND waits sullen in a nearby car.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ++. You're shitting me. Which one?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: With the bear that goes, I prefer Genero's, but I'ma --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm a bear, I suck the heads off fish, that was you?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... Woo-hoo, commercial. She waves dismissively. Harry frowns:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What are you, nuts? You, like, beat the odds. National commercial --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY \
dialogues.text: Harry. Stop. i

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I musta watched that thing a hundred times --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Harry, it's NOTHING, it's bullshit, well, okay, actually there was one sorta cool moment, I do this little wave -- (catches herself) NO. Forget it. It was nothing special. .

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, guess what, black Patrick Swayze doesn't think so. He points to a black man at a pay phone. The guy does, he looks like Swayze. Harmony sprays liquor. A pregnant pause. Harry feels giddy, Light-headed.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: . Listen. Come back to my hotel. Bring your friend. One drink, swear. You'll be home faster'n you can say Jack Robinson.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Maybe, maybe not, I can say Jack Robinson really fast, Listen: jackrobinson. He tilts her chin up. She meets his gaze, brazen... SLOW MOTION, she upends the flask, drinks... Never breaks eye contact. They're gonna have sex. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex, in progress. Two LUMPS, swaddled in a Polo comforter. Rolling around together -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SAME PLACE
dialogues.text: Harry comes awake slowly. Senses a warm body, moulded against him. Glances over in that direction -- Swears violently. It's not Harmony; it is, of course, the FRIEND. He claps a hand to his head. Looks at his watch ~- 4:42 a.m. Eases out of bed, grabs his pants... Tiptoes into the LIVING ROOM. Spots her purse. Grabs it, roots inside. ADDRESS BOOK. Finds the page...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's rental car blows by, down Sunset Blvd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNOCK, KNOCK, KNOCK. Pause... The door opens. HARMONY is there. Terry cloth robe. Hair in disarray. Pissed: -.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Do you know what time it is?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I know, I know. I'm really sorry. God... you still look great. Stunning.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Good question. This will sound crazy, but... I don't remember the hours between twelve and two. It's a blur --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Where's Marleah? (off his look:) Marleah? The-girl you --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Marleah, right. Fell asleep at my place. I don’t remember seeing you leave --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I left when you still had your tongue down her throat.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (blanches) Really..? Oh, no, no....That'’s... wrong throat. Wrong one, that's bad...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: You got ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I came here because... (deep breath) : It sounds nuts. I just think you're so intelligent, and so attractive, I -~

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Okay, stop. That's plenty.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But I --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: ENOUGH. Oh... my..-God. You come here at five in the morning to tell me how much you like me, after you just fucked my friend?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, no, see, that's just it -- I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: You said you don't remember! !

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Right! And if I was’ that drunk, I could never have. gotten it up. See? (beat) Look, I know this is... outrageous. I'm not pretending it's normal, or that I'm normal. I just... chickened out, and -- He yanks his hand back, BARELY in time to keep his fingers. SLAMM!!!! He's alone. Begins to walk -- As the streetlights blink off, one by one.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE WITH HARMONY
dialogues.text: she peers after him. Waits ‘til he's far enough away. Then lets go. and when the tears come, they gush...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I think about that night... The last sane one, as it happens. See, I was about to begin detective lessons. I'd continue to attract pretty L.A. women... but none of them would be breathing. CUT TO BLACK. A pause... then we SUPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLEET rushes out of the dark. Pelts the windshield. GAY PERRY drives, Harry beside him. Car, a mellow coccoon. A sign reads Big Bear Lake, 5 Miles.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: -- See, Jonny Gossamer would always take two cases, right? Seemingly unrelated. One's normal and the other, it's always some wild shit; then at the end they're connected, see, it's all one case.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I get that all the time. Hey, could you not root around in there--?
‘Harry's pawing through the glove box. Extracts a small nickel-plated DERRINGER. Whistles softly.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Tiny. Is it real?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: (nods) : Derringer. Fires three rounds. I call it my "faggot gun."

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Because--?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Because it's good for three shots, then you drop it and find something better. Harry's face contorts, like he just ate cat litter. replaces the gun. Perry chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: You asked, chief. Back to the lesson. Our client, so you know, is one Allison Ames, A-M-E-S, female. She’s paying for a video surveillance. Harry dutifully takes out a pad, writes AMES.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Stopped by her house today? Ms. Ames is there with nothing on but a radio. Lights a cigarette, sits in my lap...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Of course not, idiot. Hired me over the phone, paid by credit card. This job is not interesting. It's boring, write that down, use like, three extra o's. Booooring. Good. Now circle it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Circled. Five o's plus I drew a picture of a little sleeping guy, see..?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Good. Now eat the paper, which is better than the drive-thru food we'll be having on our surveillance. He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: @ HARRY and GAY PERRY come loping into view, hunched low. Squat behind a woodpile, out of sight. Perry removes his gloves. Takes out a mini-cam, grins:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Our Ms. Ames wants up close, through-the- window footage. Glamourous, huh? Hand me the blue bag. (beat) So what‘s the deal with your girl, she dissed you in high school, you said..?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh. No, not really. I mean, she... fucked everyone but me. That’s not true either, she made a concession. Agreed not to fuck my best friend Chook Chutney, even if he asked.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: That was nice of her. Okay. Stay put, stay quiet. Perry hunkers forward, toward the wood-shingled house -- @ at which point, THE LIGHTS GO OUT inside. Perry stops in his tracks. Ears pricked. Now what..? The front DOOR begins to open. Perry BOLTS. Back behind the woodpile, just in time -- As a LARGE MAN exits the cabin. Crosses to his parked car, whistling. A hooded parka makes an ID impossible.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY ,
dialogues.text: Where the hell's he going?

dialogues.speaker: GAY. PERRY
dialogues.text: How the hell should I know? I didn't make these arrangements, my client did. They listen as the car enginé REVS TO LIFE -- Along with it, a repetitive THUDDING sound. Rhythmic. HEADLIGHTS sweep past ~- the guy’s leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with his car?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: @ What do I look like, his fucking mechanic? Grab that bag and follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERRY'S Jaguar drifts to the shoulder, lights extinguished. Both men emerge, silent.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: There. Up ahead. Harry points through the trees to ANOTHER CAR, pulled over under a canopy of pines. Perry shakes his head:

dialogues.speaker: . GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Not him. Not the same car.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What the hell? He's gotta somewhere, he turned off right in front of us -- They trudge forward, into the frozen woods.. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men reach the end of a rutted dirt TRACK. The trees give way abruptly --~ Nothing. Only the lake. They exchange bewildered looks. Birds call. Wind blows.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Where is he? Just then, as if on cue -- a CAR ENGINE becomes audible. Approaching through the woods at a good clip. GAY. PERRY i Get down. \ He grabs Harry, they both go over the embankment. Stumble downward 30 feet. Perry clutches the video case. Up top, the ENGINE, drawing closer. HEADLIGHTS, above them now... Keeps coming... Something's not right. They realize simultaneously: the car’s NOT SLOWING. They DIVE for cover--! Hit the dirt, HUG it, while above them TREES AND BRUSH DETONATE, blasted to splinters as the CAR launches --

SAILS OUT INTO SPACE. Executes a lazy roll in mid-air... SLAMS TO EARTH. Gouges it..! Two feet from HARRY'S HEAD. Snow ERUPTS. Slams him. _ : Fills his mouth. He rolls to water's edge, looks up -- Sees the vehicle BOUNCE, upside down... Out into. the frigid lake. Impacts. .Hood.crumpled. Car, bobbing, headlights spearing every which-way. He can't remember getting to his feet, but suddenly HARRY is moving forward. Vision blurred. Choking on-snow. Plunges into the water. Flaps and flounders to the car. Driver side panel, at. water level. He HEAVES -- wrenches it open. Eyes darting left, right. Reacts, startled: The car has no driver. Interior, empty. Registers briefly that the GAS PEDAL is wedged to the floor. Harry backs off, sputtering. . Walk-stumbles toward shore NUMB, but now what's this, running full out, it's PERRY - YELLING something. Hard to hear, sound muffled...

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Get the keys, in the ignition, THE KEYS! Harry looks at him, half-witted --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: The sound, the sound we heard, GRAB THE FUCKING KEYS. PERRY, blundering headlong through the water. Legs churning, as, without warning -- THE CAR GOES UNDER. All in a rush, whoocoosh..! “TRUNK, last thing to go -- Perry goes with it. Harry watches, thunderstruck, as the detective PLUNGES into the freezing water. Vanishes. The surface appears pitch BLACK. From underwater, a muffled report, BANG--! Pause. HARRY, helpless. He stares. Shaking with cold... PERRY SURFACES. Comes swarming up out of the deep. Arms locked. AROUND SOMETHING, a sodden shape -- :

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: +. Help me... God...d-dammit..!

HARRY is there, clutching Perry. Hauling him up, then just as quickly recoiling -- As a GIRL IN A FLOWER DRESS emerges from the water like a Kraken. Perry gestures frantically to GRAB HER ARMS. Numbly, Harry complies --

dialogues.speaker: SHORE
dialogues.text: The GIRL flops from their grasp. Hits, lies still. Hair, plastered across her face. PERRY collapses.

dialogues.speaker: GAY. PERRY
dialogues.text: ...L~locked in the trunk.. had to... to s- shoot it open... He looks over at her -- lets out an anguished sound. POV PERRY: A dead doll in a flower-print dress.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Is... is she dead..?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: No... she's j-just... resting her eyes, of COURSE she's fucking d-dead... her neck is broken... The girl's skirt is hiked, she has no underwear. Harry tugs the dress down, a useless bit of chivalry. Perry scans the trees.. Reacts, startled -- TWO MEN IN SKI MASKS staring down at him. He locks eyes with one, briefly -- Then they BOLT. Into the trees. AN ENGINE ROARS. - Squeal of tires as a CAR drives off.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That car we saw... you get the plate?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Didn't... b-bother.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Me neither. (beat) So, this sort of thing happen a lot? Perry shoots him a look. :

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: 6 Easy, man, kidding. Come on, let's beat it before the cops show.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Nix. We... go straight to the cops.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Exactly, the cops, who will have no trouble believing that she broke her neck... (points) BEFORE you shot her in the head. Her face, what we see of it, appears beaten to a pulp -- Scalp, deeply GOUGED by a bullet. Perry's bullet. He groans, buries his face in his hands. Wind, soughing... From the rippling lake, a soft splash... Perry struggles to his- feet. Shivering.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Okay. We're outta here. (frowns) Where's my gun? @ Harry shifts, uneasy. Swallows hard:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I... I got rid of it.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Say again?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Just now. I threw it in the lake. I figured, if you wouldn't do it, I would, I got priors in New York, man, I can't be doing this --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: You threw it away?? He storms toward Harry --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, take it easy--! Perry stops. Takes a deep breath. Composes himself.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: It's okay. I... I get it, it's okay. I just got a little non-plussed... Sorry. (pauses, frowning) Whoa. What the hell..? Kneels beside the VIDEO case. Gingerly pokes at it:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: What do you make of this..? Harry leans in to look ~- Perry BOUNCES HIS HEAD off the case. Leaves a dent.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT WERE YOU THINKING
dialogues.text: Harry staggers backward, swearing. Grips his head.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: You idiot! You threw my $650 vintage revolver in the Goddamn lake, what about when they. comb the bottom, ever cross your mind, they find that car, they'll find the GODDAMN GUN??? He stands, runs a hand through his hair.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Jesus. Look up "idiot" in the dictionary; know what you'll find?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Picture of me?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: NO. The definition of the word. IDIOT, which you fucking are! He turns, fuming. Stomps his way up the embankment. EXT. LAKESIDE ROAD - DRIVING -— NIGHT PERRY drives. He's donned a dry pair of sweats. Beside him Harry's still soaked, shivering. Perry's mood: foul.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Bitch. Lies to me, drags me up here to watch a Goddamn murder... I swear, I'll -- . (stops suddenly, points:) Hey. Over there. See those tracks...? They weren't there before; they're new.
They exchange puzzled looks. Pause... Perry turns off onto the same rutted dirt TRACK. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY AND PERRY STAND, STUNNED
dialogues.text: Staring forlornly. Overlooking the exact same beach -~ Now utterly devoid of CORPSES. Female or otherwise. Serene. Peaceful. Water placid.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Maybe she, um,... wasn't dead?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Piss off. I could reach in and touch her exposed brain.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Right. So... the tide drew her out.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: What tide, IT'S A LAKE. He shakes his head, gazes out across the dark water.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: We're getting out of here, now, and this _Shit better be improving your acting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN, constant. Perry pulls up beside Harry's rental.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sorry about the gun. : GAY PERRY . Whatever. Out. Go. Sleep badly. Any questions, hesitate to call.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: "Bad"

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sleep bad.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: No -~ "badly," it's a fucking adverb. Who taught you grammar?

Harry exits into a DOWNPOUR. Barely shuts the door, Perry's driving off. Harry fumbles for his own keys -- BRAKE LIGHTS. Harry looks up in time to see PERRY reverse -- Pulls alongside again. Window slides down:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look, you don't have to apologize --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Eat shit. You forgot this. He holds out Harry's cel phone, which is RINGING. Makes no move to let Harry in the car. Harry frowns. Leans through the window. Answers the call, half in, half out:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hello..?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm trying to locate Harry Lockhart.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Speaking.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Lockhart, I'm Detective Sergeant Kale, L.A.P.D. Robbery/Homicide Division. Mind answering a question or two? Harry's stomach does a slow, lazy roll...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Of course, Officer. Fire away. In the car, Perry suddenly goes rigid. Ears pricked --

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thank you. Are you familiar with a woman by the name of Harmony Faith Lane?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I... What's this in reference to?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm contacting names in a pocket book, by all indications Ms. Lane’s.. Your number appears on a piece of paper..?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, so? She took down my number, a lot of girls have my number --  38.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: I understand. It's just routine, we're required by law to treat every suicide as a potential homicide.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Suicide.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes. Harmony Lane shot herself, sir. Just a few hours ago. She. ..wasss .. at hooo... found her... sorr... losing. yo...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello? oOfficer..? The phone's dead. Signal, lost. Harry stands there, pole-axed... like he's taken a punch. Collapses against the car. Looks at Perry, stricken:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Harmony... she's dead. He stands, rain drumming on his head.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Killed herself with a gun.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: I'll be Goddamned. Harry's face tries on several different expressions. Rejects them all. He looks out at the drowning city.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I see her for a day? One DAY?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: No making sense of it. In the end, I guess things just, um, happen for a re--

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: -- for a reason? Are you serious? Fuck that. Because I fall off a roof, ten people in Baltimore survive a bus crash? Swell. They're enjoying Baltimore, I'm lying with my brains out.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: I been to Baltimore; you win. Look, I'm really sorry. I gotta go.
He drives off. Harry, in the rain... Christmas lights, reflected in the glossy street. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, IN A BRIDAL GOWN
dialogues.text: She cuts the cake, looks up -- and SCREAMS. A big BROWN BEAR toasts her, turns to camera and says:

dialogues.speaker: BROWN BEAR
dialogues.text: I prefer GENARO'S. But what do I know? I suck the heads off fish! An insufficient little epitaph. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY enters, looking like someone turned a hose on him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I was tired, I was pissed, I was wetter than Drew Barrymore at a grunge. club. I needed a hot bath, a warm bed. (sighs) But the night had other plans for me. See, I forgot -- old Jonny, he always had two cases, remember. .?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas MUZAK plays. Harry, completely done in. Dripping. He fumbles for his key, rounding the corner -- Jumps a foot in the air. Makes a startled "bark" noise. She's there. Huddled in front of his door. Soaking wet, shivering cold -- HARMONY. Standing there with puppy-dog eyes. He stands frozen. Breath suspended. Both of them, in tableau. She finds her footing. MOVES. A rag doll. Flops into him, ENGULFS him on impact... . The two of the resemble a very emotional SPONGE. HARRY, struck dumb. REVERSE -- Tight on Harmony, on her FACE, desolate... Squeezing him for all.she's worth. We hear HARRY:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ++. How..? I... I don't... ‘ She answers him, voice uninflected, without hope:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: +». she’s gone, Harry... Still in tight CLOSE-UP. A single tear escapes one eye as it comes flashing back to her, all of it --

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: A police PHOTOGRAPHER'S flashbulb goes POP--! A female form, sprawled in a corner. Covered by a SHEET. Weapon, bagged for evidence ~- a Mossberg shotgun. FLASH TO: HARMONY, speaking to a Homicide cop:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I... I would've given her money. But... we haven't spoken... in years...

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Fact is, she stole not only a credit card, but your ID as well -- We're very sorry for the mix-up on our part... (beat) Are you willing, at this point, to make a positive identification? She nods. The barest edge of the SHEET, lifted for her --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: There, the... the birthmark. (swallows hard) It's her. It's my little sister.

dialogues.speaker: PRESENT DAY
dialogues.text: HARMONY paces: jerkily to and fro. Soaked, shivering. High on something or other. HARRY can't stop staring...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Your sister's. been living out HERE?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I didn't know; we hadn't spoken... God, in years. She never forgave me for leaving her. I... thought she’d be safe, I swear, no one told me Papa would get her back --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look, first things first, you're gonna catch pneumonia, let me ~-

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Will you listen?? I have to TELL this, someone has to believe met Harry sighs.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fine, let me get. a blanket, I'll --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I don't need a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You're shivering all over --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay. Deep breath. Tell me what happened.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: She got into my house. Yesterday, she musta been broke. Swiped 200 bucks, a credit card... California I.D. God knows what else.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Back up. If you two hadn't spoken in --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Fourteen years. HARRY. -- Fourteen years, right, and she didn't know where you lived, how'd she know, where to --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I WAS ON TV, FOR CHRISSAKES. I was on the news, you can see the house, see the number, boom, right there; getting in's easy, fucking robot broke the windows -~ Even as she's freaking out, Harry's drawn to the wet dress, the pearling beads of water on skin...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Harry, no more secrets; are you a detective?
The question comes out of the blue. Harry blinks. HARRY. Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: My friend Flicka... you said to her you're a detective, and if that's true I need your help. If it isn't, goodbye. Harry, caught totally off guard; how can he handle this?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Right. Okay. First off, say I am -- why me? Have you... looked at alternatives? There's my colleague, Perry van Shrike --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Perry, I know Perry, I’ve worked for him. Please. He's gonna believe me? When I tell him my sister didn't commit suicide? Harry stops dead. Favors her with a look of disbelief. She leans forward, intent. Locks eyes with him, says:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: See? That's why I'm here, Harry. I think my sister was murdered. I need someone to help me prove it. Stubs out her cigarette. Begins to talk as we hear:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: So I sat there, not looking at her nipples while she told me about her epiphany at the Rite-Aid on Wilshire.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Harmony, clutching a happy red basket. Soaked and miserable; she’s been crying. Sees a bottle of Old Forester. Into the basket, boom. Steps to the checkout counter. Looks down: A) bottle of booze; B) three jars of sleeping pills. Casts about... grabs Twinkies, gum. Whatever's handy, tosses stuff in without looking. Opens a Twinkie. THE CHECKER runs her credit card... Shakes his head. : Tries again. Nope. Hands the card back, apologetic.
SNAP BACK TO PRESENT DAY: Harry, looking at her nipples -

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Um, I’m sorry -- what were you buying..?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Whatever. Stuff. IT DOESN'T MATTER. Don't you get it? The card she stole from me was MAXED OUT. Right before she died, Jenna charged over 2000 dollars, you don't find that a little weird..? To some bullshit company. Ah. Plus her birth control pill for today? Gone. Red flag. Why'd she bother with her pill? Still pacing, jittery, jerky; Harry shifts uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: So. Can you help me or not?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'd have to check my schedule, but um --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Can you..? Just tell me, I'll get the hell out of your... your... Without warning, her eyes lose focus, knees buckle -- She promptly collapses. Harry has to CATCH her. He staggers, off balance. Shakes her -- Nix. Out cold. He deposits her on the BED. Now what..? He grabs a towel. Fluffs her hair. Steps back, frowning... She’s shivering. It occurs to Harry, briefly, that he’s in much the same shoes as the asshole guy at Dexter’s party. Except she's gonna get fucking pneumonia. Shit. He takes a deep breath. Tugs at her sopping dress. Hauls it dripping up over her head. Looks down -- SEES THE SPIDER crawl from his pillow to her shoulder. The size of a nickel, maybe (the spider, not the shoulder). Now it’s bound for her NECK... Harry, appalled. lLeans in, takes aim... Goes to flick the beast, MISSES..! It scuttles beneath Harmony's BRA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. He gingerly taps the bra cup -- Hello..? Mr. Spider..? Tap, tap. The breasts therein jiggle slightly. Harry takes a breath. --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very fast, and begging forgiveness he yanks up the bra. Sees the black dot against a landscape of pink, FLICKS--! Sends it sailing. Heaves a sigh of relief... Just as Harmony opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: WHA..?? I... I didn't do anything --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: You were feeling my tits.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?? No, listen, there was a big SPIDER, it was... it was... I...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: HARRY, on hands and knees. Crawling up and down, @ swearing. HARMONY, under the comforter. Getting bored.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hang on, hang.on, you'll see. Where'd you go, you little bastard... He changes directions. Harmony sighs:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Look, it's okay, I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. No, you don't. Just... hold on. It's here...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Look, whatever. Say you grabbed my tit, it's... it's life. No biggie. You got any aspirin? Harry stops. Regards her in disbelief: HARRY . A guy grabs your tit, "that's life..?" No biggie? Christ, what kind of talk is e that? I-can't believe you're --

He stops, hearing Harmony GASP:. She's looking down. Harry follows her gaze. She lets slip her bra, exposes one breast -- it's there: just visible, if you squint... A SQUISHED SPIDER LEG. On her aureole. Trailing buggy fragments. She looks at him, radiant... Granted, history has seen more romantic moments. Their eyes lock, over the severed leg. She offers a hand ~-

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: See there? I trust you. -- But Harry refuses the offer.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Whatever. I'm glad. Turns away from her. Sullen. Agitated...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY,
dialogues.text: What is it? I'm letting you off the hook, you didn't do anything --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, but you thought I did. (spins on her:) Listen to me, if I grab -your tit, it's a BIGGIE, damn, that sounded wrong, what I mean is, I'M ON THE HOOK. The hook is now my home! Meanwhile, you still talk to me..? Like... like it's an okay lapse, cops, everyone does it, Jesus, what fucking guys are you hanging around? Are you just some... some girl who -- He bites off the sentence. She looks stricken:,

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Who what..? (beat) Who what, Harry..? He retreats to the BATHROOM.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look, just... forget I said anything. Get some rest. Tomorrow we'll start ° working on your case.  46.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: So... you can do it?. You're not. too jammed up with other clients?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Let me worry about that. He shuts the bathroom door, blanches -- what the hell is he doing? He's never gonna get away with this. Calls:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Tomorrow afternoon good?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (THROUGH DOOR)
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's perfect. I'm borrowing. some sweats and a T-shirt. : He unzips. Starts to pee. Rubs tired eyes... Reaches over, opens the medicine cabinet. Fumbles for aspirin --- The mirror nicely captures THE CORPSE IN THE TUB. It swings into view. Sitting there mute, behind him. It's the girl from the lake. RIGHT behind him. Flower dress. Hair plastered across her fish-white face. Harry, OBLIVIOUS -- tugging at the childproof cap... Shakes out three pills. Pops them. Looks in the mirror-- SPITS them the length.of the room. He SPINS, staggers on one foot. A burlesque arc of urine, preceding him. Stands, blank. Utterly FROZEN. The poster boy for cognitive dissonance (yes, they have that.) Realizes, belatedly, that he's peeing ALL OVER THE CORPSE. Stuffs himself away, cinches his pants, as --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (THROUGH THE DOOR)
dialogues.text: Goodbye. I'm leaving..! Harry..? Harry says in a small strangled voice:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Goodbye. He can't believe what he's seeing.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (THROUGH THE DOOR)
dialogues.text: Thanks! This is really great. ‘Bye!
THE THING continues to be there, whether the fuck it's believed in or not. Harry fumbles out his phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry, phone to his ear, incredulous:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Say it again, they gave her BACK??

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: On the edge of panic:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: She's in my tub, I'm looking at her, for Chrissakes.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous. They don't even KNOW you, they couldn't possibly--

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: They couldn't! You're right! And since the body can't be here, this is all a dream, and oh, look, there's Elmo the elf, GOOD MORNING, ELMO! What's in your basket--

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Shut up. How'd they get. in?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don't know. Fire escape, maybe?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: (takes a deep breath:) Okay. First things first, we gotta move her somewhere. You got gloves? ;

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: If it's a frame-up, some agsshole's probably calling the cops on you right now. Do this: wrap up the body, a sheet, blanket -- a rug if you got one. HARRY ‘ Just a second, I'm getting gloves. Any particular kind?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Yes, fawn, would you fucking HURRY?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, I, uh... I peed on it.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: I -- excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I... peed. On the body, um, can they... do I.D. from that..?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Say again? You peed -~

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: On the corpse, see, my question is--

dialogues.speaker: . GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Your question. No, no, me first. WHY IN

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I didn’t INTEND to, it wasn't like I did it for KICKS!! (desperate: ) This isn't happening. It's your fault, you said this doesn't happen}!

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: SHUT UP AND LISTEN. First: wrap the body. Next, you have to find the gun. Say it with me, "find the gun.”

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Gun, I-.. I threw it in the lake --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Not MY GUN, idiot. If they dropped a body on you they also planted a gun, trust me. Move it. I'1l be there in four minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY comes barreling out of the bathroom. Runs to the closet, grabs a blanket, as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry's Jaguar throws a SMOKING 180, leaves most of its tires on the road behind it. He blows. by camera, CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: A .38 REVOLVER
dialogues.text: Underneath a sagging bed, as HARRY utters a triumphant GRUNT. Snakes out an arm, snags the gun, and meanwhile

dialogues.speaker: DOWN IN THE LOBBY
dialogues.text: Ding..! HARMONY steps off the elevator. Strides across the lobby. Idle glance at the concierge -- There are TWO COPS leaning on the guy's desk. Speaking tersely.

dialogues.speaker: COP ONE
dialogues.text: --- caller specified room 314, some sort of... brawl or something. Violent. Whoa, she thinks, that's Harry's room. But violent..? Hell, she was just there. Walks slower, eavesdropping --

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: Yes, here we go. 314, Lockhart. Let me . give you the key. At which point, Harmony surprises herself by suddenly blurting out to the cops:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: No, no, it's not 314. It's 514. I. was just up there, it’s AWFUL, all those noises.

dialogues.speaker: . COP TWO
dialogues.text: Oh. Thank you, Ma'am. Appreciate that. And on that note, Harmony, utterly perplexed, passes through the revolving ENTRANCE DOOR, out into the chill. Grabs her cel phone, she's gotta warn Harry and consequently FAILS TO SEE GAY PERRY as he blurs by, behind her. In through the revolving door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ding..! The elevator doors open and out comes Perry. Bolts down the hallway toward HARRY'S ROOM - SAME’ TIME Bang-Bang-Bang. Fist pummels the door --  50.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: @ It's me, open up! HARRY admits Perry, then quickly shuts the door. The PHONE is shrilling.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Don't answer that.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Duh. Perry, out of breath. Sees a BUNDLE on the bed, points --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: That it?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, that's the other corpse, from the last guy who stayed here.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Fuck off. The gun? Harry pats his jacket pocket. Crosses to the corpse. They kneel. Harry licks dry lips, swallows, says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry. The sons of bitches made us. Made me. .In town for two days, they know who I am, where to find me. That's --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: -- It's impossible. Yeah, I know. (looks up) Fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUNDLE is slung between them.. Propped on their respective shoulders, sagging in the middle. It's slow going; a step-by-step balancing act.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I forgot to tell you, Harmony's alive and she thinks her sister was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Come again? .

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: @ Never mind. Ouch-~!
He bashes his hand on the railing. . Swears. He looks at Perry. Perry looks at him. They stop. BOTH peer over the railing... Three stories, straight down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLYING CORPSE hurtles into frame. SLAMS down with a sick crunch. Camera pans up... Here come HARRY & PERRY, scrambling down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Keeping to the shadows, they lug the bundle toward Perry's CAR, over in a dark corner. Harry, straining:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So these dudes tonight, they see two assholes out of nowhere, they think --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: They think we must know something, sure. They panic. The body's evidence, they gotta dispose of it--

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, in my bathtub, fuck this. I want real life. You said real life.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: It is. See, real-life people aren't logical, man. They get freaked out, improvise --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Bw, shut up, you're changing your tune every five minutes. Harry slips, DROPS his end. It thuds to the ground. He swears. Bends downs... FREEZES: Headlights. Car approaching. FLASHING LIGHTS. Cops. Oh shit, oh shit, oh shit. ‘They frantically drag the corpse toward.a chain-link FENCE. Huffing, grunting... Pick a spot along the fence. Heft the bundle, brace themselves and HEAVE -- : ROLL HER OVER ‘THE TOP  52. She flops into the bushes, CRASH, rustle-rustle..! Harry follows with the GUN, chucks it, as THE POLICE CAR swings into sight and without missing a beat Perry says:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Quick. Kiss me.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What? Perry plasters his mouth to Harry's. Harry, sputtering in protest -- Perry locks him in an embrace. THE POLICE CAR cruises past. A cop shines a flashlight -- coP Check out Doris and Lucinda over here. His partner shakes his head. The car idles past... Turns the corner... Gone. HARRY flings Perry away, sputtering:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ack--! Aaaagh--! All right! All right, that's it. These lessons. suck, I quit, this is not being a detective. Corpses floating in lakes, people kissing people, this is... this is WRONG. Perry clamps a hand over Harry's mouth, SILENCES him. Out of the dark, A VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Somebody want to fill me in? The two men SPIN ROUND, startled -- HARMONY stands ten feet away. Defiant. Without missing a beat, Harry turns, whispers to Perry:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: She thinks I'm a detective, go along with it, don't fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Harry, did-you know the cops are looking for you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (startled) They are..? He jogs over, takes her aside.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I sent them-to the wrong room, I didn't know what else to do --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You did fine. See, Perry and I, we're running a whatchamacallit, a... you know, the old... game... bring 'em in, push 'em , out...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? What's happening, and why were you and Perry nacking on each other? Harry smiles. Clears his throat, takes a deep breath --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERRY'S Jaguar zips along as we HEAR: INT.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I sent her home, believing a) we'd meet tomorrow to go over her case; and b) I wasn't actually gay. Do not ask me how I did this. Then Perry says we gotta move the body again. Four a.m., it's in the trunk, we're cruising down Santa Monica, past the cool-looking police station with the palm trees and -- aw, shit. (beat) Listen to what I'm doing, I'm saying it, meanwhile it's on the screen, I hate it when the narrator does that... "I entered the building and proceeded to Bob's office," you're like, I KNOW, asshole, I'm watching the fucking movie. Sorry. CAR —- DRIVING - NIGHT i Harry says:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why couldn't we just leave it there?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Think, dummy. A911 call, your room number, then there's a corpse outside your hotel? Bad idea. . (beat) Speaking of which, what's this shit, you taking on an actual case? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAY PERRY (cont'd) Of all the dipshit things to do. Killed herself, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Killed herself. I just solved your case for you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Harmony's convinced that--

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Fuck Harmony. Little Sis punched her own ticket. Period. Here, this looks good, up ahead. Time to lose the luggage. He rolls .to a stop under a big shadowy TREE.

dialogues.speaker: CUT. TO
dialogues.text: As the BUNDLED CORPSE hits the lawn of a Beverly Hills home. HARRY bends over it, face a misery mask:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sweetheart, you deserved better. Wind picking up, the trees rattling, he runs... CUT TO BLACK. A Pause... then SUPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window we see HARRY asleep. The NEON LIGHTS outside his window sputter... Come to LIFE. CLOSE ON HARRY -- his eyes pop open. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator disgorges Harry, unshaven, bleary-eyed. He passes a PLUMP WOMAN with a collection bucket.

dialogues.speaker: PLUMP WOMAN
dialogues.text: Rejoice in the Miracle, the Lord is risen.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It's more of a miracle that I arose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY and HARMONY, seated at a window table. Harry's trying to look official with a notepad and pen.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay, so -- you said you have a line on why Jenna came to L.A. Tell me. I'm taking notes, so be as thorough as you can. Harmony sips her coffee. Speaks quietly, intently.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I never told you just how... awful he treated her. My Dad, I'm talking about. (eyes vague, distant) I remember, I only lied to her one time... Papa was making her cry, saying shit, and afterward I bent.down, real close and I whispered in her ear. (beat) I said, "baby, the man living here is not your father.'

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: e@ You told your sister she was adopted?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) I went one better. I said her real father was an actor in the movie that came through town. The Gossamer thing. I said, 'Someday, baby, you'll go to Hollywood, and meet your famous. real Daddy.' (beat) . Harry, I think she believed me. I think she came out here looking. ‘

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You sound pretty sure.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I read her suicide note. Even with a gun to her head, she mentions "Daddy". Harry nods. Glances down. at his own extensive notes: x C_€«* ‘ of? sexe WA Es ar ‘BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
