dialogues.text: Got it. I'm on the case. (scribbles on a napkin) And here’s my card. He presents it with a flourish: THE AMAZING HAROLD.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It's a magic card, by the way. Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Oh, Wow. Any training required?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nope. Just say abra-cadabra.

dialogues.speaker: . HARMONY
dialogues.text: What happened, did someone sue you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: It used to be “Alakazam.” When you cut me in half. And not-to be picky, but you e@ were Harold the Great. There eyes meet. He shrugs, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I used to be great, now I’m amazing. Live with it. His CEL rings, he answers:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hi, there was nothing in the papers. I'm busy right now with Harmony's case.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Case, what. case? Leave her alone. News on channel 9, just starting. Call me after. Click-! Hangs up. Harry. jumps up, heads to the BAR -- TV bolted to the wall. On screen, a striking NEWSWOMAN:

dialogues.speaker: NEWS WOMAN, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: ++. a kidnapping gone wrong. It is unclear why his daughter was subsequently murdered, or even where; e (MORE)  fC ._. NEWS WOMAN (ON TV) (cont'd) for she was almost certainly killed and then moved, police sources say. Veronica @ Dexter's abductors remain at large. (beat) Harlan Dexter, 53 year-old actor-turned- entrepreneur, runs the prestigious Dexter Clinic downtown, along with a series of rehab centers. His wife died last spring, prompting Veronica's return to the U.S. -- and a. father-daughter reconciliation, following years of estrangement. Veronica Dexter; 25 years old yesterday. More later. Paul?

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mina. Sad. Brought together... only to lose each other again. Very much like the cast of "Giant Steps"; coming up, a report on the hot new show that -- On Harry's speechless reaction we cut. to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brisk, windy. They walk side by side. Harry takes out gum, offers a piece to Perry. e@ HARRY Ronnie Dexter? Are they, like, triple- sure..? ‘Cause she sorta looked like Mr. Potato-Head to me.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: I.D. was positive. Scars, dental records.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Talk to your police guy? '

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Not much there. Lab test came back, no sign of rape. (frowns) Boils down to this: at 4:30 yesterday afternoon, Ronnie Dexter left home to meet some dude at the airport, old boyfriend. Off she went --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And that's the last anyone saw of her? .

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: r With a symmetrical ungooshed head, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Police ever find the car?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Uh, no, genius, that was us, remember?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah, right. Harry looks pale. Perry fixes him with a steady gaze:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: It was someone at that party, Harry... That's how they recognized you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The killers were... at Dexter's?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: (nods) This is getting way too scary, man. You gotta bail. Catch a flight out.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But my screen test is Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. You won't get the part.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Listen to what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I know it's a longshot --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Harry, you're not getting the part.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So I'm not Brando, you think I don't know that? If there's even a chance --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: There isn't, YOU'RE NOT GETTING THE PART, YOU NEVER WERE. It bursts out of him. Harry stops, mid-sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick Cage wants too much money. Get it now? Dabney, he unearths a "discovery." New kid, works for cheap. He flies you out, high profile. The parties, detective lessons, ALL of it. (beat) He's using you to shave a million dollars off Cage's price. And there it is. Out on the table.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Sorry, chief, but there it is. I'm done lying to you. So. That's it. If you're gonna take a swing at me, do it no-- The PUNCH snaps his head around. He SWEARS, as Harry launches another left -- ducks this one easily. Spins Harry, SLAMS him against a mailbox. Twists cruelly.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You son of a bi--aaaGGHHH. Perry lets go. Steps back, still wary. Harry, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: And don't bother keeping your date with Harmony. She wasn't happy to hear that you. weren't a detective. That you lied. Anothér shock. Harry, overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You... you TOLD her..?? (almost in tears) Man, I... I thought you were, like, my friend! I was'in trouble, you were right there -- ‘

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Protecting my employer, yes, (off Harry's look) DABNEY. My employer? He pays me to insulate him from corpses. Harry absorbs this like a physical blow.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: I'm not a nice man, Harry. (beat) Go home. Before something bad happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry turns. Heads for his car.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Are you... are you THREATENING me..? Pause. Perry blinks, confused --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: No. NO, you idiot. I'm saying the BADGUYS might try to harm you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh, okay. Right. Perry gets in his car. Keys the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas. Sorry about fucking you over.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No problem. Merry Christmas. Don't quit your gay job. The car rounds a corner. Disappears from sight. Harry sighs. Runs. a hand through his hair. Headache. Temples, throbbing. Grabs his cell, punches buttons. Ring..! Click-!

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm unavailable to take your call, but if you leave a mes-- He hangs up. Inhabits the lengthening twilight. Nowhere to go. Spits. Scans the IVY alongside the hotel... FLASH: He and Perry, tossing the .38 over the fence -- Harry makes a decision. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry appears at the door, trailed by a homeless man -~

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS. MAN
dialogues.text: Buddy, got a cigarette..?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Not today, pal.  61. The man grips his arm -- Harry shrugs him off, hard.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: Rat bastard, son of a bitch -- Harry keeps moving. Into the store. Empty. Reaches up to his KNIT CAP, the one he had in Big Bear -- Pulls it down into a SKI MASK. Moves to the register; no one there either. He palms the 38 revolver. Rings a tiny BELL.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE IN BACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just a minute! Right out! Harry waits, impatiently. Drumming his fingers. Ski mask, itching. .He leans over the counter, reaches... Awkwardly swats at the register button.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, can I get some help here?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE IN BACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Coming! Another second! Harry ducks beneath the counter. Pops up behind the register. Punches buttons. Nothing. Again -- nothing. Last try -- Bingo. The drawer slides open. Reveals maybe $200 in worn bills. .20 in'change. He stares...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE IN BACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Be right there! Presses a hand to his head. Shoulders start to slump... He shuts the drawer.. Cash untouched. Tugs off. his mask. Eyes dull, glazed. Ducks beneath the counter again. A HISPANIC MAN appears.-- Sees Harry standing politely.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: -HARRY
dialogues.text: ..» Marlboro Reds, box. ‘EXT. HOLLYWOOD BLVD - NIGHT Harry exits. .Sees the angry BUM. Tosses him the smokes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Choke on ‘em. Crosses the street. Doesn't look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main concourse. An amplified VOICE intones:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: At this time, we'd like to begin pre- boarding for flight 12, service from Los Angeles to New York, at Gate 42. HARRY appears. Takes out his ticket. Resigned, tired...

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY FLASH
dialogues.text: A deserted.field, behind the high school. Foreground: YOUNG HARRY, 18 -- facing 16 year-old HARMONY.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Gotta catch my bus. If I don't go now, I never will. I'm gonna miss you... She hugs him. He gazes past her at the stadium CLOCK: now or never. Presses his mouth to hers-- she recoils.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: No... Harry, you mean so much to me. It... It's different with you. If we do it, it'll be magic. Worth waiting for. BACK TO PRESENT DAY -- Harry steps aside for a young child. Mutters politely, examines his ticket -- STOPS. Looks. up, frowning. Is it..?. Nah. Couldn’t be, yet -~ IT Is, IT'S FLICKA. , Walking the concourse. Pulling her stewardess cart.

dialogues.speaker: WITH FLICKA
dialogues.text: She glances up, sees HARRY. hustling toward her. Won't even look at him. Eyes front, says:

dialogues.speaker: FLICKA
dialogues.text: She doesn't want to talk to you.  63.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: @ I know that. Maybe... maybe I don't want to talk to her. Ever think of that? Maybe it's you I'm interested in.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKA
dialogues.text: Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, no. Listen, she has a cel phone, right? She must. FLICKA. . Forget it. This-is between you two --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: HERE. Look, a ticket, see? Baby, I'm going. I just want to say something, anything to her... I... I'm begging you. Pause....She heaves a sigh:

dialogues.speaker: FLICKA
dialogues.text: I'm gonna regret this. Unzips a pouch in her carry-on. Pulls out a telephone- r slash-address book, flips through it:

dialogues.speaker: FLICKA
dialogues.text: Let's see... Where is it, not here... that's funny... Oh.. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What? What's funny?

dialogues.speaker: FLICKA
dialogues.text: Nothing, I forgot it's listed under ,her stage name.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No kidding? What's her stage name..?

dialogues.speaker: FLICKA
dialogues.text: -.- Ames. Allison Ames.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Huh... Look, I really appreciate this, I promise I -- He stops. dead. Mid-sentence.  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say that name again?

dialogues.speaker: FLICKA
dialogues.text: Ames... A-M-E--

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Allison Ames, that's... that's Harmony's stage name??

dialogues.speaker: FLICKA
dialogues.text: I think I just said that.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And is that the name on her credit cards?

dialogues.speaker: FPLICKA
dialogues.text: How should I know? Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY is gunning it,.fifty-plus. Phone to his ear:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY., (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You have reached the offices of Sentron, Inc. Please leave a message.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Newsflash, Perry. Your client, Ames, it was the little sister, repeat, the little Sister. That's where Harmony's two grand went, it's in your bank, you overpriced bastard, HER KID SISTER HIRED YOU. Your case and my case, man, now hear this, it's the same fucking case!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry leaps from the car. Runs to the guest house. Pounds on the door. Pause. Pounds again.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Harmony, it's me. Something's happened, it's about your sister. (pounds) I HAVE TO TALK TO. YOU. What happens then happens quickly: Harmony FLINGS open the door. Harry extends his hand: ‘

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Listen, I just found out --

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT OF MY LIFE
dialogues.text: She rears back like Nolan Ryan, SLAMS the door--! Cuts off his finger. Harry grunts. The color drains from his face. Pause... She throws open the door again.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Hey, did I just cut off your fi--? She stops. Sees him hunched, blood squirting. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: A DOCTOR SEWING HIS FINGER BACK ON
dialogues.text: ECU of half a forefinger, as a needle draws stitches. To one side, a coffee mug -- red-tinged ice cubes, we're

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY, on local anesthesia; inventing .swear words, M.O.S Over this, bleeding into the next scene, we HEAR: ©

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (ON TELEPHONE)
dialogues.text: You're a genius. A GENIUS. I’m so sorry I bailed, I had to go to work, oh, Harry, I’m going nuts, I can’t stop thinking about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry slouches, hand bandaged. Phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’s Jenna’s part in this -- I mean, how’d she know where Ronnie Dexter would be murdered? She sent you. and Perry to that exact place. Is that crazy or what? A pause. Harry mulls it over for a second, blurts:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, Harry, I'm'so sorry... How is it? HARRY. All shot up. ‘Can't feel a thing. (beat ) Where's Perry? We gottatalk to him.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He's gonna stop by here. I can try the pager again.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Won't matter. Pager, phone, they both went swimming. You on catering detail?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Party up on Sunset Plaza. Listen, remember you said the killer may have been at Dexter's party? Well, that whole bunch is here tonight.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Put me on the list.. I'll be-right over.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you still doped up?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Put me on the list. I'll drop by. Maybe I can stir.the kettle a bit, you know? Stick out a hat, see who shoots at it.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Maybe you should put the hat in the kettle. Then if they shoot it'll. ricochet. Harry, you sound trashed.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Gimme the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TAXI deposits HARRY in front of a Gothic monstrosity. THROB of music from within. Voices, laughter.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A young girl from Indiana comes to L.A. -- Can't hack it, cancels her subscription to Life. Voila -- reality. Case closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along the wall, at intervals, WINDOW DISPLAYS. Tastefully naked men, women. Painted. IGNORING the outside world. Not allowed to react to it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Or was it..? Murder; suicide; either way, the girl was dead -- but now it mattered to me, I had to know. HARRY joins the milling crowd. Wanders outside into the

dialogues.speaker: BACK YARD
dialogues.text: A crush of bodies. Dancing, drinking, occasionally falling. VIEW overlooking L.A., a panoply of lights.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, IN A SKIMPY SANTA GETUP
dialogues.text: Emerges from the house. Spots HARRY, waves. Elbows her way forward -- Fetches up next to him, clutching a bag.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I got it. Just now, my friend Tiff does video dubbing at Fox. Passes him the bag. He removes a TAPE, scans the label:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: "“Koo-koo For Cocoa Cocks."

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Wrong label; it's the Jonny Gossamer movie. If Jenna was hunting her Mystery Dad, this is where she'd start, right? (beat) And Harry, get this -- the big stores never heard of it. Four specialty shops had a copy; one apiece. All rented.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: You don't find that odd? A box office dud from 1980,. and on a given night FOUR people take the only available copies?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (sighs) Okay, listen, let's not go crazy with the conspiracy stuff.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Don't patronize me!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm not,.I just -- He breaks off as PRETTY GIRL steps up, indicates HARRY:

dialogues.speaker: PRETTY GIRL
dialogues.text: Um, I don't know if this guy's your boyfriend or not, but just so you know, while you were in. the bathroom he was totally checking me out. She strides away smugly. Harry, ready to snap. Looks at Harmony like everything's her fault.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's it. What IS it out here, these... these women...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Please, they're no different fro--

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, yes they are. These are damaged goods from way back. (simmering) Show me a guy, sleeps with 100 women a @ year. Go back in his childhood? Dollars to doughnuts it's pretty unspectacular. (beat) Now. Show me a woman, sleeps with 100 guys a year, check out her. childhood and I guarantee you there's something rotten in Denver --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Denmark. HARRY ‘ There too. Abandonment. Abuse. THen they all come out HERE, it's like someone lifted America by the east coast and shook it,. and the normal. chicks managed to hang on. He stops, realizing it's grown very quiet around them. Every woman within ten yards is staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone who hates Harry here, ‘ raise their hand. @ Half a dozen shoot skyward. A VOICE rings out:  69.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: See that? Obedient little bitches, too. GAY PERRY knows an entrance line when he sees one. He joins the party. Ducks a flung drink, keeps walking as it hits an old lady. Falls in beside Harry & Harmony:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Okay, you got thirty of my fucking seconds. Thrill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmony waves all of them inside, shuts the door. Moving quickly now. Turns on one. of those combo TV/VCR units that run $150. Hands Harry a sheet of paper --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Cast list. (turns) Perry, catch. She tosses him a VISA card. Issued to Allison Ames.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: So, who's in this cinematic milestone, anyhow?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Michael... Beck? Whoever that is.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Ah. He starred in Xanadu. (off their look: ) Olivia Newton-John, Gene Kelly. What? Harry jerks a thumb, mouths the word "gay." She nods. Adjusts the TV unit, hits PLAY. Clears her throat:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Now. Perry, indulge me, I know this is, like, a longshot -- Perry isn't even listening, points RIGHT AT THE SCREEN:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: That's Harlan Dexter.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: So don't jump all over us, you never know when someth-- beg pardon?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: There. That's fucking Harlan Dexter, he's 25 years younger, look. She stops, mid-oratory. Blinks. Turns, and sure enough: There's DEXTER, 27, punching Michael Beck in the gut. © Harry, Gay Perry, Harmony. All staring, slack-jawed. Harmony hits PAUSE. Harry snatches up the cast list -- ECU LIST: Midway down... DEPUTY -- Dexter Holcomb

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Shit. This... this makes sense. He had the Gossamer books at his house.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Used to be an actor... Harmony sits bolt upright:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. No way. (eyes widening) : Harry, the other night -- you remember, I said our host, he looked familiar? She takes an involuntary step back, like she saw a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Oh, God. I remember him, now. 1979, he was there, I SAW him -- (points to the screen) I saw him like that. Young.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Whoa, slow. down -- saw him where? j

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: At our house. In Indiana. He came with the movie people. I think... I think he was the one who started Mom on those books, God, is that true..? She looks from one to the other, shell-shocked. An uncomfortable pause. Harry and Perry exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And your sister has to have seen this, so what it comes down to... (frowns) (MORE)
HARRY (cont'd) You tell your sister a fairy tale about @ her real father...

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: That brings her out here 20 years later, hunting Harlan Dexter. . Harmony, now, looking even MORE haunted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAY PERRY is shrugging into his coat.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: I'm going to Silverlake. I have a surveillance. Do NOT play detective. Understand? Two women are dead, this is not a book, this is not FUN.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I know that, you think I'm stupid?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: You wouldn't know where to feed yourself if your mouth didn't flap so much. He walks away. Harry sighs. Unwraps a stick of gum... @ Alone again. Except for a MERMAID behind glass. Harry waves howdy. Gets the required blank stare. Takes the video bag. Blows it up, makes as if to POP it... The only thing that moves is her middle finger. Unfurls, pointing at Harry. The eyes remain blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY wanders, zoned-out. Tired. Party, surging nearby. He's on the outskirts. Sips a stiff drink, it's been a looooong day... Bumps someone, starts to apologize -- No need. The guy KEEPS bumping him. Crowding him, as ANOTHER MAN materializes, falls in alongside, what--? The bastards have him flanked. Cosby/Culp duo. One's black, the other white. Tall. Leather jackets. Harry feels a GUN in his ribs:

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER JACKET
dialogues.text: Keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groans, shakes his head)) Perfect... Just perfect...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lead him around the side of the house. To a pocket of deep shadow... PARTY noise muted, distant.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: Well, now. Here we all are, Ike, Mike and Mustard. Even through his burgeoning terror, Harry's confuséd:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ++. What the hell's that mean..? Leather #2 looks up, frowning:

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: I gotta go with him on this one, man, that's pretty fucking obscure.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: Horseshit. I hear it all the time.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: e You do.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: Where, at the 1942 Club meeting?

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: Hey, just ‘cause you didn't get in-- 1 Harry tries to act indignant: 4 , HARRY. This is bullshit. Who the f--aaaGGH..! Leather #2 strikes him with.a lead SAP. Harry half- whistles, half screams. Leather #1 leans in:

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: Friend, what you.are in here is what we like to call a JAM. Boy, do we like to call it that.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: You said it. I could call this a jam all night.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: You wanna know who we are? Real simple. Me? I'm the frying pan, see, and my buddy over here, he's --

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: Mustard. I'm Mustard.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: -- He's the FIRE, fuck you, Mr. Mustard. NOW. Me and my man, we're puzzled by your behavior lately. Such as: --

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: Such as, why is a saavy stand-up cat like yourself consorting with gay men, frolicking in a lake together?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You were there..? With the masks, that was you? The guy grabs Harry's bandaged hand --

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER JACKET
dialogues.text: Pal. You don't ask the questions. Twists, WRENCHES --—

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Aaahhh...! Oh, shit, OH JESUS you tore it off, you tore off my FUCKING FINGER!! The bandage is now STAINING itself a deep red. Somewhere under it, a detached digit.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: Now, I bet there are doctors in New York, clear that shit right up. Leather #2 drives a FIST into Harry's kidney.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: L.A. don't want you, tough guy.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHER
dialogues.text: Go home, sport. Don't make your daughter an orphan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: } Harry collapses, clutching himself. Retching. Watches i their svelte tan loafers, walking away... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARMONY, zipping along in her SUV. HARRY in the backseat. Lying prone, cradling his hand.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Five minutes away, hang in there. Harry..? Hello..? You with me?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Talk to me. Our mascot, back in school -- what the hell was it? You remember?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Whitey. (grimaces) The white knight. 'Spose it's better than. calling him "Knighty,”" then he'd be "Knighty-Knight,” pretty soon the mascot's named "Ta-Ta,” or "Toodles," and eo then you're really -- Harmony interrupts with a startled yelp.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Harry! That's them. 12 o'clock, look! You said a black guy and a white guy? A BLUE IMPALA -- directly ahead. -Two forms, clearly visible inside. Big.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, that's them. Get the plate, call the cops.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I will, I will. Lemme find a pen --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Whatever, watch the road. Hello..? (beat) What are we doing? Are we slowing down?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I was leaning over to get a pen. 74.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: @ Harmony, you are not following them. Please tell me you're not --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I'm taking you to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, I HOPE so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just, they're on the way, is all.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I'm NOT. (turns around) You wanna go another way? ‘Cause I don't know about me, but they're headed for the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, speed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just told me to get the plates! (shakes her head) Sheesh, beat him up, he gets grouchy. THE IMPALA makes a sharp turn. Onto a cross street.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Straight. We go straight.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I know that. As she blows through the intersection, she sees the sign: Silverlake Blvd. Frowns. Takes a second to register...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Perry's stakeout.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Perry's stakeout, he said Silverlake, didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What's that got to do with anyth--

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. It's a setup. The stakeout, they set him up, they're going after Perry!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ho, wait a second. My finger's hanging off, we gotta move on this --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Sure, meanwhile they're murdering Perry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Maybe. It's a STREET. They could go left, right, maybe they're going to the damn movies -- .

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: You wanna take that chance? Look, we'll go save Perry, we'll do it really quickly, then we'll go fix your finger.

dialogues.speaker: . HARRY
dialogues.text: But -—

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I'll be incredibly fast, I promise, "Hey, Perry, look out," boom, back in the car. Cool? Cool. She throws the car into a SMOKING U as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmony cruises the boulevard, eyes roving. Up ahead, the entrance to a wooded PARK.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Ha! Bingo. The BLUE IMPALA. Parked at the curb. Empty. Harmony lurches to a stop. Twists around, says: HARMONY. They're on foot. If I leave the keys, can you drive yourself?  77.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (sighs tiredly) Yes. Yes, I can. Go. Harmony nods. Takes the .38 revolver from Harry's jacket. Stares at it with silent awe. Swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Okay. Here I go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmony heads into the park. An afterthought, she loses the Santa hat. Sadly, there's still the costume: not so much deadly as adorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the backseat, he sits up. Fully intends to transfer to the front. Reaches for the door handie. Scenery, spinning... Deep breath. Tries again... topples to the FLOORBOARDS, unconscious as

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: Up ahead, we see a form we recognize: MR. FRYING PAN crosses from a gas station, sipping coffee. Reaches the parked Impala, phone to his ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh... Anybody around him..? Terrific... On my way. Got. you a danish. He clicks off. Gets in the car. Reaches in a pocket -- Extracts a Sig Sauer AUTOMATIC, and meanwhile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARMONY, crouched low. .38 held loosely at her side. Low MIST, inches off the ground. The lamps have HALOS. She moves forward at a dead run. In and out through the trees. Eyes roving -- That's when she first notices THE GIRL. 25, give or take. Torn jeans.. PINK HAIR. Punk-ish. Harmony ducks behind a tree. Watches the girl stroll out of the park.  Now Harmony sprints uphill to a BRICK WALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one that borders the park. Roughly five feet high. Finds she can stay to this side of it and still see the STREET, where Pink-Haired Girl walks. Still a block downrange. Harmony looks back at the park. Reacts, startled: Now there's a strange MAN in the park. Strolling south, eating peanuts. She fidgets. Peers over the wall again -- .

dialogues.speaker: THERE HE IS, THERE'S. PERRY
dialogues.text: Coming out of a LIQUOR STORE two blocks down. Harmony heaves a HUGE sigh of relief... PERRY, meanwhile, sucks on a beer. Ambles along, shadowing PINK-HAIRED GIRL; his aforementioned surveillance job. No idea Harmony's near-- Except she's not so near, not anymore. She's 75 yards away. She creeps along the wall. Keeping him in sight.

dialogues.speaker: HEADLIGHTS
dialogues.text: A car, nearing the park... She thinks nothing of it. Glances up as it goes by, then promptly turns to STONE -- THE BLUE IMPALA is back in the picture. Gliding like an Angel of Death. She watches, terrified, as it moves down the block. Closing on Perry. Harmony starts to run.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: One foot in front of the other. One, two. .One, two. Feet slapping the ground. Eyes dead ahead. Locked on target.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: He doesn't hear her, or doesn't acknowledge. She hits pace. Legs scissoring. It's a solid pace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 135 139 She doubles it. Arms pumping. Legs pistoning. FASTER now, faster than before. Lets loose, FLYING... The man with the peanuts TRIPS her. She never saw him coming. All of a sudden she’s sailing... Hits, wham--! Slides on wet leaves, and now -— MR. FIRE (aka Peanut Man) is ON HER, clamping a hand to her mouth. Bearing her to the ground, got her by the

dialogues.speaker: THROAT --
dialogues.text: She HEAD-BUTTS him. Everything she's got. He rears backward, HOWLING. Nose flattened. . That’s done it. Harmony breaks loose. DIVES, rolls -= Comes up sprinting. Goes airborne..! Leaps atop a trash can.. From there to the WALL. Straddles it, up and over--

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, LOOK OUT
dialogues.text: She tumbles off the wall, flailing. THE GUN goes flying. Strikes the pavement, GOES OFF, Bang--! A picture window EXPLODES. Collapses. THAT. gets Perry's attention. Two blocks away, he SPINS - SEES HEADLIGHTS -- Sudden and HUGE. 135 What happens next happens quickly. PERRY DIVES. Onto a parked car. Rolls across the hood, nick of time as the Impala SIDESWIPES the car, WHAM-! and somehow A GUN MATERIALIZES in his hand, like a magician’s trick and WITHOUT A THOUGHT he sticks it out behind him and while rolling, blows two shots backward at the Impala --

dialogues.speaker: WINGS THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: Guy takes it in the shoulder, car goes shrieking past and

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, NOW
dialogues.text: Smacks the pavement, HARD. Rolls, comes up --

VEER, crazily. Out of control. FIRES after it, three more shots, starts to run. Up. ahead it strikes the curb, doing fifty ~- Blows its tires. CATAPULTS onto the sidewalk. Captures a fire hydrant -- Buries itself in a LIQUOR STORE. Shelves ERUPT. Wood, BLASTED to splinters. Finally shudders to a halt, as THE UNFLAPPABLE MR. FRYING PAN tumbles out. Hits, rolls -- comes up moving. Drawing his pistol. Heads for the door, running full out -- Unfortunately running in full view of the store OWNER, who promptly blows the shit out of him. POW! POW! POW! Drops him. Guy dies more surprised than anything else. And it's over, just that quick, and consequently GAY PERRY simply reverses direction -- as the corpse topples he's already loping back the way he came. Car alarms SINGING their song. A geyser of WATER spouting thirty feet high, and meanwhile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK-HAIRED GIRL, on the run. Terrified. Gunfire, murder, this wasn't in the libretto. She sees Harmony'’s SUV. Door open. Keys dangling in plain sight. Salvation. She jumps in, keys the ignition, goes roaring off. Never bothers to check in back... Where HARRY, unconscious, inhabits the floorboards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERRY shoves HARMONY over the brick wall. Follows a second behind, into the PARK.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: The girl with the pink hair. She ran this way, did you see her?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: N... No. And the man, he... got away. I... I couldn't shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: It's okay. You did great, you did just fine. SIRENS, now. Flashing LIGHTS, drawing near. They stagger off. The dark absorbs them. DISSOLVE TO...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY'S SUV
dialogues.text: As HARRY comes slowly awake. Groans. Disoriented. Sits up. Extricates himself from the floorboards. Peers out the window: finds himself ina tidy one-car GARAGE. TIME CUT: HARRY EXITS THE VEHICLE. He takes his bearings. Totters toward the side door. Past TRASH, brimming... He stops. Frowns. Backs up. Focuses on one barrel. Paper, coffee grounds... A BAG. He pulls it free: ALLEN'S VIDEO -- The Specialist. Then another -- Rocket Video. Another. Another. Four bags altogether. This is too creepy. He replaces them. A SOUND. Harry whirls --! The DOOR’s opening. He reacts, darts behind the suv -- Ms. PINK-HAIR emerges with a collie at her heels. Snags a LEASH from a wall peg. Exits to the street. Gone. The house is his.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: Harry moves upward, silently. Second floor. Peers into rooms... Christmas TUNES, on the CD player. Droning. He finds them in. the bedroom: FOUR COPIES of Jonny Gossamer. On the nightstand. 20th Century Fox, 1979. Well, I'll be damned, he thinks -- Then FREEZES. Swears under his breath. THE FRONT DOOR is opening again downstairs. No way. Less than two MINUTES? Whatever the case, she's back -- And SOMEONE ELSE is back. Harry hears a male VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: First things first, you gotta get rid of that car. Ditch it.  82. Harry pokes his head into the hall ~- Ducks back, fast. They’re on the stairs. Her head appears, she’s saying:

dialogues.speaker: PINK HAIR
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I know you said there'd be... consequences, but... I.. I saw. that man shot to death. I was so scared. Coming to the bedroom. No time, no time to think -- He drops flat. Scrambles beneath the bed. Peers out: Sees a set of pressed male SLACKS appear. Then JEANS, sneakers; the girl. She sits on the bed, Harry feels it.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S8.)
dialogues.text: Yes, of course, we should absolutely talk about. it.

dialogues.speaker: . PINK HAIR
dialogues.text: Thanks, thank you so much.” It's nothing against your. boss, I... I'm grateful...

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: I understand. Believe me. I spoke with him, and you won't have to do anything like this ever again. Swear.

dialogues.speaker: PINK. HAIR
dialogues.text: You mean it?

dialogues.speaker: MALE. VOICE
dialogues.text: Yup. A phhhtttt-! of sound. Another. An inch away, Harry sees the carpet leap up--! BOTH SHOTS penetrate the bed. It's all HARRY can do to keep from screaming. ,.He FEELS her topple. She flops to the mattress. Rolls off the bed. Strikes the floor. He recoils -- ‘ She's RIGHT THERE, inches away on the carpet. Back arched spastically. Mouth open. And even as he registers the bloody wounds, the fact that she's not gonna make it, her HEAD lolls to one side, eyes wide in shock -- SHE SEES HARRY. All of a sudden, sees a strange man . under her bed. Maybe five seconds left to her. ‘Says:

dialogues.speaker: PINK HAIR
dialogues.text: Who... are you..? Her eyes, inches from his. The two of them, close as lovers... And Harry panics. Reacts instinctively. Jams a finger to her lips. CUTS HER OFF. Withdraws it. Presses it to his own lips. Eyes pleading with her, please, oh, please be quiet... Her mouth works soundlessly. The light. behind her eyes, dimming. She looks to him, afraid, IMPLORING -- He wills her SILENT, that's right, honey, just for the next few seconds, good girl... Seconds are all she has. She passes them in pain -- And then, obediently silent, she dies. The lights go out. Her breath escapes. Harry having denied her a single word. This will haunt him for as long. as he chooses to live. He shifts his attention: watches the tailored slacks exit the room. - Hears something plunk on the dresser top. HARRY peeks his head out. Looks to the dresser -- There. Sitting all by its lonesome: A silenced AUTOMATIC. The son of a bitch left his gun. Harry breaks cover. Climbs to his feet. Crosses to the dresser. An automaton. Calmly claims the gun. Checks the safety. Flicks it off. Turns, hearing FOOTSTEPS approach. Grits his teeth. Bides his time -- MR. FIRE DOESN'T SEE HIM at first. Appears in. the doorway, putting on gloves. Blanket, over his shoulder. Then he does see Harry. Guy's a pro, gotta give it to him. A flicker of reaction; that's all.

dialogues.speaker: MR. FIRE
dialogues.text: Hey. You still around, tough guy? Got a gun, I see. Damn. You are tough. Harry DOUBLE TAPS, ba-~bam--! Puts two in his gut.  84. FIRE regards him in stunned disbelief. Looks down. Sees red. . Harry pauses, adjusting his aim -- Then he just keeps pulling the trigger, burning new holes. SHOT AFTER SHOT. The guy jitters, perforated -- Flops against the stair rail. Overbalances. Legs, yanked up and over -- Plummets. Slams a glass coffee table, explodes it. Bounces once. Hits, dead.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, THE EXECUTIONER
dialogues.text: Watches SMOKE rise from the gun barrel. A song begins: "I Saw Three Ships.." . He kneels beside the dead girl. Grimaces as he wipes the gun and places it in her hand. HARRY. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: FIRE's GLOVE, fallen. Harry bends -- Picks it up. Shrugs it onto his good hand. Staggers into the kitchen. In shock. DOG barking. Out in the garage. Without thinking, he opens the door, admits the beast. It wiggles with joy. Harry checks the cupboard. DOG STUFF. Leash, bowl... Medicine, yeah. Takes ointment. Hydrogen Peroxide. Here's the gross part, UNWRAPS the injured hand... Reaches into the mess. Plucks free his precious FINGER. Sets it on the table. Crosses to the sink, extends his ‘hand -- DOUSES it with peroxide. He nearly SCREAMS. BEHIND HIM -- we see the DOG, paws on the table... Steals the FINGER. Prances off, tail wagging. Harry moves to the table. Stops. What the hell..? Looks underneath. Looks to the side. Hears an excited little whuff--! from the corner -- HAPPY DOG dangles the finger. Waggles his head, come get me. Harry's in no mood. He makes a grab for the dog -- - The animal DODGES. . Vanishes around a corner. Pause...
Sticks his head out, peeks back at Harry. Another little whuff--! This is fucking insane -- HARRY'S PHONE RINGS. He jumps. Stabs the talk button --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, what?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm... I'm with the kidnappers, one of them, anyhow, he's... he's dead, I shot him, Harmony's car is parked here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Harry, wipe the place clean and get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, man, I... I can't. I WANT to.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So DO IT.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My... my fingerprint's here, man, the dog's got it.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: HARRY. No one's gonna dust the fucking dog --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, asshole, he's got the finger, the whole thing, with the... the print part, I think he thinks it's a game. ;

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Get the finger. Kill the dog. Get out of there.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hang... hang on, I think -- As he watches, the dog raises its muzzle -- CHOMPS, once. Throat convulses. An audible gulp--!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I, uh... I think we're safe. Hey, Perry..? (pause) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee HARRY (cont'd) Perry, I... I shot a guy. I never done @ that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: | He hits the button. Hangs up. Starts to cry. DISSOLVE: | A TV NEWSWOMAN, doing a remote from outside the same . house:

dialogues.speaker: NEWSWOMAN
dialogues.text: ++. Have been linked, through items found within this Silverlake home, to the kidnap-murder of socialite Veronica Dexter. Police theorize a possible falling-out between the kidnappers, resulting in at least two deaths and possibly a third tonight, as... She goes on, we PULL BACK from the TV screen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A patched-up HARRY sits with HARMONY & GAY PERRY.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: So. This evening, was it "Jonny Gossamer" enough for you? e HARRY Tell you the truth? Jonny Gossamer always has a WAY bigger ending. Harmony, you know; there's a part where he gets tortured --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Tortured, sure. Then he breaks free and shoots sixteen guys.

dialogues.speaker: . HARRY
dialogues.text: Always sixteen, funny thing. (beat) So listen... It's... it's over, right? They said the kidnappers were all dead -- HARMONY and PERRY exchange an awkward look:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Harry, I'd be lying if. I said I didn't still have.... questions. (off Harry’s look:) Harmony's sister -- if she stumbled on a * murder plot, why hire ME to go film it? Why not simply call the police?  HARMONY speaks up:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: And I still think the daughter business is wanky. Last summer she says Daddy siphoned off Mom’s estate. Sues Daddy. Flies to L.A. to put Daddy behind bars.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Has this... thing, this reconcilement-- GAY PERRY. Reconciliation, idiot. Yeah... Everything changes, boom. She withdraws the suit, moves in, suddenly they're inseparable.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So, what are you saying, we're gonna, like, probe deeper..?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. Isn't that right? He casts a pointed look at HARMONY -- she scowls. A TEENAGER across the room pipes up:

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys talking about a murder? Perry looks around, startled.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: You just said you saw that Dexter chick gettin' killed. Someone paid you to film it.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: No, no, we were just talking.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Oh, 'cause I heard you say it just a second ago. .

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Look, pal, we're making a movie here, .capisce? About-the murder.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Already? Man, that's quick! Perry shakes his head. Gather his coat, starts to rise --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well, it worked.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: No one else thinks so.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don't count?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i You're new here. Look around, there's younger and better.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don't want younger and better, I want you. (flinches) Um, that didn't come out right --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter. Look, I should go -- She turns, slings her bag over her shoulder. Harry looks up at the winter moon. A pause... then:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ® I steal shit.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: (blinks ) Come again?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's what I do for a living. I steal audio-visual components. He regards her with an odd, thoughtful expression. HARRY ‘ I've never finished a Goddamn thing I started, ever. School, marriage... can’t even take off a lousy liquor store, halfway through, boom -- I cut and run.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Like the other night, you’re all over me, then you give up -- HARRY e Switched to the homely friend, exactly. Listen, please don’t go yet, this... : e (MORE)  HARRY (cont'd) (beat) This isn’t finished. They stand, breath pluming in front. of them. She sighs:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Does this dump have a bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stumble in, tipsy. He sets his drink down. In the dark, watches Harmony shed-her top. Step out of her skirt. HARMONY, her toned, contoured form... Then a quick FLASH: DEAD GIRL, wet dress, molded to her. BACK TO NOW: Harry blinks.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I just thought of something. (looks up) Ronnie Dexter. I saw her body up close, hell, I carried the damn thing. Both times..? The dress was, like, soaked through, transparent.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Where are you going with this?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Perry said this chick was heavy into the born-again bit, but... ah, it's probably nothing, just... well, if she had on underwear, I didn't see any, um, I guess I'm taking the couch--? HARMONY has dispensed with underwear. Slides into bed.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks... I mean, you could sleep here, but... it would just be sleeping, if that's gonna frustrate you -- He finishes his drink. Shrugs. Slides in beside her. He. pulls her close. Begins to stroke her hair. She sighs deeply -- lays her head back on his chest.
gl.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: So long ago.. Since I.took that midnight bus. Things didn't really... turn out how we hoped. Did they?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I can think of worse places to be. She meets his eye.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Is that so, Whitey..? Her voice soft, slurred... He rolls his head toward her.

dialogues.speaker: / HARRY
dialogues.text: You calling me a knight..?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Maybe, yeah, except for the boner; that’s not too knightly, I guess --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The hell it isn't. Nightly and most mornings. She giggles. Closes her eyes. They lie there. Outside, rain falls. Neon flashes. Pause -- Harry sits up.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fuck it. I'm not a knight. I'm going nuts here. He switches on the lamp.

dialogues.speaker: . HARMONY
dialogues.text: Harry?. I'm sorry. If I'm teasing, if... if you're... I mean, I can do... well, SOMETHING, if you're all uncomfo--

dialogues.speaker: HARRY,
dialogues.text: No. For Chrissakes, no. He stands. Dry-washes his face with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don't want you to offer it as... as, like, a COURTESY, I -- She stops him mid-sentence. Slips out of bed -- Materializes before him. Presses a finger to his lips...  nn Finger, the opening act for her mouth. They kiss. A coin-toss who's more frightened. They pull back...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I... wow. I saw fireworks. Did you see fireworks?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: No, but I was facing the other direction. (sad sigh) Oh, Harry... Once we do this, you'll stop calling me.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's crazy. You're my dream girl, this... this is destiny. Pause. She regards him searchingly... nods, sighs:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Okay, Harry. Tonight, I'1l believe that. She rolls atop him. Eyes, luminous in the half-dark...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: For one night..? I'll believe anything. They fall together; few years. late, a buck or two short.

dialogues.speaker: SAME BED
dialogues.text: Harmony, sprawled. Smiling. Spill of hair across a pillow. Harry beside her, looking suitably worn-out. CLOSE ON HARRY: Seeming peaceful... His eyes are closed... Suddenly they OPEN. He frowns:

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: Harmony, 16. Saying goodbye to HARRY. The exact same FLASHBACK we viewed previously (page 64) --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (AGE 17)
dialogues.text: Gotta catch my bus. If I don't go now, I never will. I'm gonna miss you... But now, the camera ACCELERATES, sort of fast-forwards thru the goodbye... ZIPS past Harmony, veers UPWARD--! WHAM--! Stops dead on the STADIUM CLOCK. 92. i
WITH HARRY, PRESENT DAY -- His eyes snap OPEN. He speaks softly, as much to himself as to her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Uh, Harm..? Way back when, the night you left Indiana -- You, uh... you sure you took the midnight bus..? Not the 8:30?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Hmmm..? Oh. 8:30..? Yeeahhh... Guess you're right. DUH. Seemed later. By now, though, Harry is frowning furiously --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: She didn’t want me to give her a ride...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: YOUNG HARRY gets into his car, watches HARMONY's retreating form, moving off through the tall grass... Here we go again, as CAMERA overtakes her..! : Zips past, makes an ARROW toward a house... lone MAILBOX out front; painted there, a name: CHUTNEY. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmony's PURSE comes flying out. Strikes her in the chest as she stands outside the room, in tears.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (sticks his head out) You said you were gonna quote-unquote "wave goodbye" to him. Chook, my best friend, Jesus!! HARMONY . I_ just. stopped by, I... 7 ‘

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: For three and a half-hours?? You made it with Chook Chutney. Just say it.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I... I'd never see him again, he... he looked so sad... : (scoops up her purse) Harry, for Chrissake, this was forever ago, I was a different. person..!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Watch your hand. She withdraws her fingers -- He SLAMS THE DOOR as hard as he can. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARMONY. does the Walk of Shame. Stumbles out in tears, using her .rolled-up socks and panties as Kleenex. A TAXI pulls to the curb. She gets in. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH FLOOR
dialogues.text: There she goes. Sorry, sport. He looks haggard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARMONY, brazenly weeping. Fishes in her bag for an | actual Kleenex. Stuffs in the panties and socks -- Abruptly, she FREEZES. Breath suspended. Something goes click behind her eyes. CUT TO: INT. HARRY’S HOTEL. ROOM - SAME The phone RINGS, startling him. He snatches it, rasps:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: «+» Yeah... HARMONY, barely intelligible -- clearly just sobbing:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wah she waped..?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S,)
dialogues.text: The Dextow Gool. Waped -- Raped. Sowey. Harry falters, caught off guard -- clears his throat:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. . Um... M.E.'s report showed... no indication of... stuff. Rape. Click..! He stares dumbly at the receiver. Huh? . Slowly sets down the phone. Sighs. Looks at the bed... Stops, squints -- she’s left something behind:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the BOOK she lifted from Dexter. Must've fallen from. her bag. Harry bends down, scans the title -- Straighten Up and Die Right - A Jonny Gossamer Thriller Cover: LIGHTNING flash. JONNY walks a rainswept city... Harry tosses it aside. Flops full-length onto the BED -- CUT TO BLACK. Pause... then SUPER:

dialogues.speaker: DAY FOUR
dialogues.text: Next. thing HARRY knows, WHOOMPH--! He's being SWATTED in the face, repeatedly. GAY PERRY hauls him out of bed --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Huh--? But... what did I do--?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY'S IN TROUBLE.
dialogues.text: (beat) Grab a fucking coat and let's go.

dialogues.speaker: FOUNTAIN AVENUE
dialogues.text: PERRY, in a highly agitated state. Fishes out a pocket recorder, hits Play. Holds it up:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (ON TAPE)
dialogues.text: Perry, me. Listen, this. Ronnie Dexter business stinks. I'm gonna check something -- something Harry said. Call me. If I'm right, you're gonna shit. He clicks it off.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: What did you say to her?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Back up. I don't get what's happening --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: What's happening is she solved this thing. I know her. The sly little bitch saw something I missed and she solved the case. Now she’s disappeared. He draws a ragged breath. Pounds the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Before she left -- Did you talk about the case? Anything at all, think.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Heading west on Fountain... Pause... Pause... SCREECH-! It stops. U-turns. Goes hurtling back the other way.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I tell him about destiny; he’s shaking his head. About seeing fireworks; he doesn’t care. I mention the underwear thing -- he has a fucking conniption. (beat) And you? How about it, filmgoer? | Have you solved "The Case of the... the Dead People In L.A.?" ‘Times Square audiences, please don't shout at the screen. And stop. picking that, it'll just get worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera CRANES DOWN past trees; past a sign: DEXTER CLINIC: Rehabilitation Center. In through a WINDOW... A FAT WOMAN sits fashioning a clay Santa. She is insane. Smiles without warning. Makes odd darting movements. Behind her, someone CLEARS HIS THROAT. She turns -- Sees HARRY and PERRY standing just inside her door.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Good evening, Ma'am. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: They gave away my crickets.. i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to hear that. Say, listen... have you by any chance seen this woman around? Holds out a snapshot of HARMONY. She shakes her head, no.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: (bull by the horns) Ma'am, I hope you won't take offense when.I ask if you're . wearing anything at all under your hospital greens. Undergarments. It's important.  She doesn't miss a beat. Steps out of her bottoms -- Stands brazenly nude, holding Santa.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That... is one sorry ass... clay. Santa.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: They walk briskly, checking room to room. Harry whispers:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's the clue, isn't it, Ronnie Dexter was here. She was a patient.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: (nods ) i Private clinic. Where even nice girls don't wear undies. Harry frowns:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yo. How could Ronnie Dexter be a patient while she's having birthday parties and dancing and shit? Perry turns, exasperated. GRABS Harry by the shoulders -- they lock eyes:

dialogues.speaker: GAY . PERRY
dialogues.text: Harry, think. First she hates her Dad, then she loves him. Sues him, then backs down. WHY? I'll tell you why -- HARRY speaks, then, so softly we can barely hear him:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. It's two different girls. He looks up at Perry, eyes haunted.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He stashed his daughter in here... while a ringer took her place. Perry nods. Touches the tip of his nose. FOOTSTEPS, approaching. Perry grabs Harry. Yanks him inside a BATHROOM --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY ARE SILENT as a whistling ORDERLY passes by outside. Harry shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This is nuts. You, of all people -- Perry nods grimly. Leans against the sink. He breaks

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: All he needed was a girl who looked enough like her to appear in court and withdraw the complaint. {soft chuckle) No one’s gonna believe us. They'11 say it's right out of a Jonny Gossamer book.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Of course it is. The guy-who planned the crime READ ALL. THE GODDAMN BOOKS. They're in his house. Plus he was in that piece- of-shit movi-- off, mid-sentence.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. Turns slowly, regards Perry from.across the room.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, man..? Listen, this girl, this... impostor, um, you thinking what I'm thinking? Perry shrugs. Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: I'm a desperate.man, in need of a replacement daughter... Same time, along comes a girl. Harmony's sister, looking for her Daddy. HARRY . Fresh off the bus. Blonde, petite-- . GAY PERRY . I'd say I found my impostor. (beat) Puck it. Let's get out of here.  99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit by the back door, furtive. Come waltzing up the loading ramp. Crossing the parking lot. Toward the surrounding TREES --

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Good evening, gentlemen. A VOICE, behind them. They spin, startled. Caught. like deer in headlights. AN ORDERLY in hospital whites. Tall, muscular... Fully armed. Swell.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Sir, hi. Um, we're lost -- The man unholsters his REVOLVER.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Mr. van Shrike, hello. Aren't you chilly? Come back inside.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Actually? I'm from back east, I'm kinda digging the cold --

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: Or I can kill you here. Perry sighs. Damn. It's never easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard marches. them back toward the building. The bar of the pistol jammed in Perry's back.

dialogues.speaker: GAY. PERRY
dialogues.text: (jovial) You know, Harry, I was thinking some more about real life versus fiction.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Is that a fact?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Like how, in movies, you stick a gun in some schmuck’s back, you say, "keep walking,". and no sweat, you got a hostage.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I do believe I've seen that film.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Funny thing is, a real pro insists on five feet of separation, the reason being... Perry transforms to an urgent BLUR. Spins, lashes out--! SWIPES THE GUN, pretty as you like.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: ~- The schmuck will take it off you and make you eat it. (savage grin) Down the hill. In those trees. Now.

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS
dialogues.text: The GUARD falls to his knees. Perry's got his own pistol, Harry the revolver, and no one's in.a particularly good m

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Tell me where Harmony is.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Mary.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Pal, you don't get it. This. ain't good cop, bad cop. This is Fag and New Yorker, you're in deep trouble. (sullen silence) For Chrissake, what are you protecting? It's over. Finis. Dexter's going down. He begins ticking off items on his fingers. GAY PERRY . I know about Ronnie's lawsuit, I know Dexter was facing ruin, and killing her wouldn't fix it. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAY PERRY (cont'd) (beat) I know he switched daughters, e@ which, God help us, actually DID work, at least until last week -- Harry chimes in:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, what happened, that he had to kill her? Perry restrains. himself:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Harry. You wanna put a sock in it?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm just asking. --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: You don't ask questions, now it looks like I'm guessing, we don't know shit!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Right, right. Sorry. e@ GAY PERRY And for the record, it was Ronnie's old boyfriend. Guy flying in from Paris, remember? (back to his prisoner) Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Fuck you. GAY PERRY ; Exactly. Dexter decided to cut and run. Killed Ronnie, threw a dress | on her. Faked a kidnap, dumped the body and walked away clean. Except for one thing.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Underpants.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: One lousy pair of cotton undies. Pretty funny, huh? (chuckles) I'm gonna break your nose now.
eo He palms the gun, SLAMS it home. GUARD, nose shattered. Perry cocks the gun:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Picture a bullet. inside your head, chief. Right here. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Fuck you... (spits blood) And anyway, that's ambiguous.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me? How is that ambiguous?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY -
dialogues.text: I think he means that when you say, “picture it inside your head;" okay, is that, a bullet will .BE inside your head, or is it, picture it in your head, like, form an IMAGE, see what I'm saying?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: e@ Will you shut up?

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Look. I don't know about a girl. Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. -- You know what, the hell with this guy. Step aside. Harry, galvanized, comes forward. Dumps all five slugs from his revolver. Replaces a SINGLE BULLET in the cylinder -- Spins it. Steps past Perry. Kneels, says:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The girl. Harmony. WHERE IS SHE?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? Harry winks at Perry. Levels the gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARR’

dialogues.speaker: YY
dialogues.text: You wanna play hardball? Huh? _FINE. I can do that. Where. Is.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRL
dialogues.text: Pulls the trigger, CLICK--! Except it doesn’t go click. Just like that. Bang-! He's wearing the guy. GUNSHOT, echoing on the breeze... A frozen moment. PERRY, speechless. The corpse topples sideways, clunk. Harry, eyes wide. Shaking his head. No. Can't be. It NEVER goes off the first time...

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: What did you just do?? HARRY . No, that... that wasn't supposed to... I only put one, one bullet --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: You put a LIVE ROUND in that gun?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I never meant to... There was, like, an eight per cent chance, I just figured --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Eight per cent.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well, maybe more...

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Eight per ce--WHO THE HELL TAUGHT YOU

dialogues.speaker: MATH
dialogues.text: Abruptly, Perry's cell phone BEEPS..! STARTLES them. "I Will Survive," touch-tone. He kills the ringer, hisses:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: What? INTERCUT —- GAY PERRY & HARMONY - ON THE PHONE :

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Perry, hi. It's me.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: At home.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: At... At HOME..?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just got in. I was out buying a phone. Are you okay? You don’t sound good ~~

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: What... What about your lead --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, that. Ah, never mind, I had this crazy idea, straight out of Jonny Gossamer --

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: It’s not crazy. Don't talk, just listen: call downtown, see if Ronnie Dexter's body has gone to the mortuary. Find out if there's a cremation scheduled. Call me back. ~ He clicks off. Turns. Sees HARRY sitting, ashen-faced and trembling. Hugging his knees.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Come on. He woulda killed you, he said so. GET UP. We’re through here. He grabs Harry's arm, yanks him to his feet. Turns, storms uphill to ‘the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What about this guy?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: I’1l get the car.. You shot him, you drag him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just below the lip of the hill, Harry drops the corpse. Calls up to Perry:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay. All set. (brushes himself off) So, listen, I got an idea. Let's take this son of a bitch Dexter down. He crests the hill -- Stops. Draws a sharp breath: HARLAN DEXTER himself is leaning against a car.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: -- um, down to... the racetrack, buy the son of a gun a drink, what do you say? Um, Perry..?

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, TO HIS LEFT
dialogues.text: Hands behind his head, while Dexter's bodyguard AURELIO covers him with a short-barreled shotgun. Harry shakes his head. Like a kid having a tantrum.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. Not fucking fair..!

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Aurelio. Give Mr. van Shrike a pat- down. Aurelio steps forward, clearly not thrilled. Starts to fr Perry. The detective pretends delirium. Moans. Grinds his hips. Aurelio YANKS free. Spits.

dialogues.speaker: AURELIO
dialogues.text: Fucking maricon, shit. Perry's CEL PHONE chirps again. He looks a question at Dexter -- : _— foe DEXTER Toss it here. Let‘s see who it is. Aurelio fishes out Perry’s phone, tosses it -- Harry move without thinking. SNAGS it, hits the button, says:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: We're in trouble, Dexter's got us-- oooff! A punch to the sternum, paralyzing -- Aurelio recovers th phone. Puts it to his ear, LISTENS... Smiles.  106.

dialogues.speaker: AURELIO
dialogues.text: He just asked a carpet cleaning service to save him.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Sorry, Harry. Good hands, though.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ++. Used to... be a magician...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmony, on her newly-bought cell phone --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: And, for an additional $39.99, we'll carpet up to three rooms in... in HALF the time! That's a $40 value -- Act today! Listens... Nothing -- She's moving. BOLTS for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURELIO hums a holiday tune... Applies gel to ELECTRODES. Plops them on Harry's testicles. DEXTER looks on.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (playing tough) The chick in ‘the casket... she ain't even gonna match the ringer you been toting. around... Ever think of that, genius--?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: (tiredly) Of course he did, Harry. That's why he’s having. the body .cremated. Dexter nods, impressed. Just then his’ phone beeps..! He puts it to his ear. Grunts. Hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Speak of the Devil. Gotta go. He shrugs into his coat. Waves to Harry and Perry:

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Perry, nice to have known you. Um --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Harry.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Harry, of course -- Glad to have met you, hope you won't judge Los Angeles based solely on your experience tonight. He exits. Heels, clocking away down the hall. As he departs, an ORDERLY ENTERS carrying an ominous black BOX.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (swallows hard) Hey, Perry... I, uh... I'm kinda scared here, man.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Aurelio, give the kid a break. Do unto others, and all that. It's Christmas. Perry squirms -- and instantly the gun trains on him. The ORDERLY attaches two trailing WIRES to the black box. For the record, Aurelio’s got another. gun; this. one a plastic WATER pistol. Throughout, the sick-o spritzes Harry every so often. Perry snarls at him:

dialogues.speaker: GAY. PERRY
dialogues.text: You like this, don't you, you pseudo- macho shithead? You know, you could zap this guy in the chest -- sure be simpler... (frowns) Hmmmm. Know what I think? I think you like lookin' at his works. Is that it--? Aurelio PISTOL-WHIPS him. Perry grins savagely:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Dude, face it. You got it in you, man. The ORDERLY ‘looks to Aurelio -- Aurelio nods -- He turns up the rheostat. HARRY SCREAMS. Thrashes. PERRY, seemingly impassive. A TIC betrays him. He begins to FLEX the fingers of his hand, over and over...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: A TRANSPORT VAN backs toward the mortuary doors. Arrayed around the van, four DUDES, all natty in DARK SUITS. Ostensibly mourners -- oh, please. Drug addicts. .
She coasts to the curb. Lights off. Peers out -- @ As HARLAN DEXTER, NOW, pulls into the mortuary lot. One of the apes approaches --

dialogues.speaker: APE
dialogues.text: Mr. Dexter, sir. The coffin's here. He looks up. RAIN, starting to fall... Nods, says:

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER
dialogues.text: Let's burn the bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurelio speaks calmly to Harry, GUN never leaving Perry:

dialogues.speaker: AURELIO
dialogues.text: Who. Else. Knows..? Who did you tell?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No one, I... I swear... I don't even LIVE here...! Another twist of the dial. HARRY arches backward. The current abates. He sags, semi-conscious. Comes round, ) gagging, coughing -- And that's it. Gay Perry's had it.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: ENOUGH. Aurelio, look me in the eyes. Look me in the eyes and say the words, "I have never had.a man." Come on, do it.

dialogues.speaker: AURELIO
dialogues.text: Fuck you, maricon.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Is that a yes..? I didn't hear you. AURELIO i: I will enjoy having you as a patient. \

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: You believe this, Harry? He can't say it.

dialogues.speaker: AURELIO
dialogues.text: Enough. SHUT UP. GAY PERRY . Why can't you just say it? Huh? If you're not gay, tell me. JUST TELL ME.

dialogues.speaker: AURELIO
dialogues.text: I will do nothing you say to do.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: ‘Cause you CAN'T. You've done it, you've smoked pork, and you DAMN WELL KNOW IT. (grins) Listen to me, you piece of shit, I've seen it from Day One, you WANT me -- PERRY JAMS HIS HAND down the waistband of his slacks.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Here it is. You want some of this? Come over here. You want a shot of this??

dialogues.speaker: AURELIO
dialogues.text: Shut. your Goddamn mouth--! He springs forward, GUN poised for a savage blow -- Doesn't feel it at first; doesn’t realize his kneecap's exploded. A TONGUE OF FLAME leaps, unbelievably, from between Perry's LEGS. Aurelio blinks, dumbfounded. Catches on quick -- As THE DERRINGER fires again. Takes him in the head. Drops him -- Perry's moving before the body hits. Jerks his legs upward. SPINS -- Swivels on his ass, one smooth motion, FIRES-! Wounds the orderly. Downs him. Then he’s up, crossing toward. HARRY -- who's staring in comic disbelief. Perry reveals his little 3-shot gun, it emerges from his pants.

dialogues.speaker: GAY, PERRY
dialogues.text: Homophobes never search there.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thank God you... had a gun in there... For a second, I thought it was... a gay thing, somehow... you guys just DID that.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Can you stand? Walk?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Neither.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Wrong answer. Up and at ‘em, chief, I'll help. Come on, you're Jonny fucking Gossamer, you're electric, baby. Harry groans. Reaches down... Pulls up his pants.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I take... beatings... and spit them out... for breakfast...

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: ‘Anything you say, chief. Come on. He heads for the door, Harry's arm slung round him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dexter's SUITS, huddled just inside the building. Suits Harmony just fine. She approaches the VAN DOOR, undetected. Lifts the handle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here, the DRUMMING is cacaphanous. Harmony spots the COFFIN in back. Wriggles next to it, raises the lid. Clicks a penlight, directs it down -- a reverent whisper:

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Oh, God... No way, we’re right.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: She FLINGS herself over the seats. Brake, off. Snaps her belt. Checks the mirror. Keys the IGNITION -- Chaos. Men, POURING out of the doorway. Shouting -- She gets rubber and PEELS OUT. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY & PERRY burst through the door, into the DELUGE. Struggling forward, Harry’s in bad shape...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARMONY comes flying out of an alley. Slides through a hard left, throws a ROOSTERTAIL of water --  111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS, startles her. Built into the van, a hands free intercom. Rings again. She fumbles for it:

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello, Harmony! Happy Holidays.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I got your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let me guess: you want your friends.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Without a scratch on them.

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Or else?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Or else I take your daughter out on the town. Show her off. .

dialogues.speaker: DEXTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I see. Well, you two girls have fun. I'll get back to you shortly. Click--! He's gone. Suddenly, another ring: HER phone.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: (hits the button) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, how'd you get away?

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I fired a small-calibre gun I keep next to my balls. Listen, they hid my car. We're on Olive, by the freeway, any way you could --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I'm thirty seconds away. Be where I can see you, be ready to move. She glances in her mirror, draws a sharp breath -- A BLACK SEDAN, closing fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. They're on my tail, gotta go. She hangs up. Stashes the phone. RAIN, coming in sheets now. Obscuring the road. Up ahead -- FREEWAY. She checks the mirror. They’re closing fast. She tromps the pedal, BLAZES forward... The SEDAN RAMS HER from behind. She swears. Fishtails madly. .The van crosses the center line. SKIDDING. She snaps around, facing forward -- A PICKUP TRUCK. Bearing down. She screams--! Cuts the wheel. VEERS, last second --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On foot, HARRY & PERRY watch, helpless, as THE VAN GOES OVER SIDEWAYS. Smashes down. Slides, 40 miles an hour, out of control -- IMPACT. Strikes the freeway OVERPASS. Ricochets off, whipsaws..!

dialogues.speaker: COFFIN, EJECTED--
dialogues.text: The ornate crate SAILS... end over end, glistening... Comes down, wham--! Atop the big GREEN. FREEWAY SIGN. Lodges in the struts. Stuck. The COFFIN BURSTS OPEN, not all the way -- Enough to admit one trailing HAND. One dead girl's hand dangling limp over the freeway. Spotlighted. Festooned with Christmas lights. Got it? Good. Now let's wind the.clock back 5 seconds; because another, concurrent result of the crash is --

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, FLUNG LOOSE--
dialogues.text: Expelled along with the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: MUD-SLOPE.
dialogues.text: Parting gift: the door CRUNCHES her leg -- Then she's. tumbling free. Downslope, head over heels, bouncing, skipping--! Toward the rushing TRAFFIC. Events now accelerate; the next 5 pages, all in a rush -- Harmony slams to a stop. Breath driven from her lungs... Above her, THE CASKET looms, backlit. Strangely beautiful. She'gapes, wide-eyed... Pow--! MUD, spattered. She spins, startled -- SOMEONE JUST SHOT AT HER. There. Up at the fence -- the SEDAN. A shadowy FIGURE... raising his arm... She acts on instinct; Rolls BENEATH THE OVERPASS -- Almost gets away clean. POW--! A bullet tags her. Oh, shit. CREASES HER, skull-deep. She flops in the surrounding dark. A rag doll, as, ABOVE

dialogues.speaker: HARRY AND PERRY
dialogues.text: Come charging and/or stumbling. Huffing, wheezing. They near the OVERPASS. TRAFFIC below, whooosssshing by-~ Harry -- bobbing, weaving. We realize he's been tortured, he's a mess. He slumps. Nearly falls to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY-
dialogues.text: Harry’s shout, full of pent-up rage, frustration --

dialogues.speaker: 20 YARDS UPRANGE
dialogues.text: Actually? He might want to tone it down a bit, because

dialogues.speaker: HIS VOICE CARRIES
dialogues.text: The GUNMAN, halfway in the car. Stops, looks -- : And that, brother, is when it goes all to hell.
The guy reacts: spins, smoothly, GUN coming up...

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
dialogues.text: Jesus, get down!! Events proceed in the following order:

dialogues.speaker: GAY PERRY
